boardgame.name: Confusing Lands
boardgame.description:
Confusing Lands is a microgame for 2 players in which each player creates their own wacky floating landscape! Get ready to discover majestic mountains, trace flowing rivers, and encounter the occasional cute little deer!

Players take turns playing cards containing various symbols and scoring conditions. Once both players have played 8 cards, they each tally points based on a single shared scoring condition as well as the other scoring conditions present in their finished landscapes. The winner is the player that created the best confusing landscape! Which is to say... the player with the most points at the end of the game!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Manitou
boardgame.description:
In Manitou, you are an intrepid explorer discovering and developing new islands in a watery world. But powerful forces are at work against you. Other eager adventurers are trying to distract you from your mission and wreak havoc on your carefully laid plans. Anticipate their actions, set up your defenses, and plan your attack! In a battle of wits, will you be the one to create the most populated island?

Players play cards from their hand to develop or destroy islands. In Manitou, you play cards of your own color as well as of your opponent’s color which creates a unique aspect of gameplay. Specialty cards (Whirlpools, Lighthouses, and Bridges) add an additional strategic element enabling players to take either an offensive or defensive posture.

After all the cards are played, the winner is the player with the single-most populated island. An island is one or more cards of the same color which share at least one adjoining edge. Each card has a number in the center representing its population and the population of an island is the sum of all the cards that make up the island.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Hidden Page
boardgame.description:
From the Wizards of the Coast website:

Decades ago, a wizard named Sylvene came to the Sword Coast from another plane of existence called Ravnica. While exploring Waterdeep and nearby lands, she met and fell in love with the father of her child. She built a refuge for them in a small demiplane of her own creation, but eventually she went home to Ravnica with her infant son and never returned.

Now her grandson seeks to recover relics of her power by exploring Sylvene's history in the Realms—and he doesn't care who he hurts along the way. The consequences of his careless pillaging already ripple out to impact others.

This Dungeons & Dragons adventure is written to suit four to six characters of 8th level. With this text and the core D&D manuals, you have everything you need to play.

boardgame.name: The Enemy Within Collector's Edition - Volume 3: Power Behind the Throne
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Slipcased collector’s editions of Power Behind the Throne (2nd edition) and the Power Behind the Throne Companion with exclusive variant covers.

boardgame.name: The Enemy Within Collector's Edition - Volume 4: The Horned Rat
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Slipcased collector’s editions of The Horned Rat and The Horned Rat Companion with exclusive variant covers.

boardgame.name: Aegis of Empires Adventure Path (5E)
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

A Legendary Epic!

Strange things are afoot in a ramshackle house in the back streets of Eber, but the heroes who pull that first thread will find murder, mayhem, monsters, mystery, and magic aplenty in this massive adventure series from award-winning author Greg A. Vaughan and his talented team! Eldritch tomes hold ancient secrets better left forgotten, as sinister cults, secret guilds, and malevolent masterminds weave a continent-spanning conspiracy that threatens doom for all. Ancient enemies will rise and a legacy of sorrow and betrayal bears bitter fruit, but the lure of fortune and glory draws the heroes ever onward in a breathless race against time and rival forces, with redemption and cataclysm balanced on the edge of a knife and the fate of untold thousands at stake. The elder empires do not rest easy, and you must decide whether their restless slumber awakens into a dream or a nightmare.

The Aegis of Empires Adventure Path is a 5th Edition adventure saga for taking characters all the way to 17th level, from gritty urban adventure, chilling mysteries, epic wilderness journeys, and fabulous lost cities ranging across the length and breadth of the spectacular Lost Lands Campaign Setting. This rich and exciting world 20 years in the making has been home to dozens of adventures from Necromancer Games and Frog God Games and produced with their cooperation to be compatible with The World of the Lost Lands campaign guide!

While designed for use with the Lost Lands, these adventures are loosely connected rather than following a strictly controlled plotline, enabling you to easily place them into any campaign world. Your heroes can explore at their own pace to discover the secrets of antiquity or be consumed in their seeking as they brave the dark paths of the Aegis of Empires. In addition to six awesome adventures, you'll also find over 50 new monsters and over 100 new magic items, spells, rituals, deities, and equipment items for your 5E campaign! Grab this fantastic 598-page adventure saga for the 5th Edition of the world's most famous roleplaying game today and Make Your Game Legendary!

boardgame.name: echoes: Die Tänzerin
echoes: La Danseuse
echoes: The Dancer
boardgame.description:
The ghost of a young girl is haunting a Scottish manor, and the echoes of the past hide the secret of her death. See whether you can unravel this secret in echoes: Die Tänzerin.

echoes is a co-operative audio mystery game. Using the free app, players listen to mysterious noises and voices that are connected to the playing material. Together they look for hints in the sound bites to bring the story parts in order and solve the case.

In more detail, your task is to assemble the 24 parts of the story in the right order; each part is represented by an object — either a game board or a card — and its associated echo. The entire story is divided into six chapters, with each chapter being represented by a game board. By scanning the objects with the app, you'll hear the echo connected with each object, and by using conversations and noises in the echo, you try to figure out which three object cards are associated with a chapter and in which order they should be placed. If you're not correct, the app will inform you which cards are incorrect or in the wrong place; if you are correct, you can listen to the entire chapter all at once — and you should since new, additional hints can then be heard.

The objects themselves also provide you with clues from time to time, so neglect no details.

boardgame.name: Color Code
boardgame.description:
A color says more than a thousand pictures.

Everyone has color associations for certain terms. Which colors do YOU associate with Surfing, Music, or Magic?

As a team you try to match up your inner color associations. Put yourself into the other players' minds and together solve the COLOR CODE!

The active player gets three topics and must secretly assign one of seven (more as the game progresses) colors to them. The other players then discuss and guess which colors the active player chose for each topic. For every match, they get half a point.

boardgame.name: Wiedźmin: Stary Świat – Zagubiony Wierzchowiec
The Witcher: Old World – Lost Mount
boardgame.description:
Each story has its silent heroes. Those who do not expect applause and hide in the shadows. Those about which epics and poems are silent. After all, those without which the events of the epic stories could not have happened. It is said that witcher horses are so trained that - when called - they will travel any distance, having no regard for narrow roads, rivers, and buildings ...

The Lost Mount will appear on the board in a random place at the beginning of the game. When, during the game, one of the players finds themselves in a location with a Lost Mount, they can use it to travel (they get additional cards to do so). Then, the Lost Mount will be lost again, and go to another location - waiting for the next meeting with one of the witchers.

Lost Mount is Kickstarter (crowdfunding in general) exclusive expansion.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Iconic Hero: Solo Superhero Roleplaying
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Solo play uses a couple of simple dice mechanics and tables to provide the answers that the Game Master [GM] would normally give you when you play.

No table can possibly know your hero’s situation. You need to take the answer and apply it to the panel or page. Solo play is a great workout for your improvisation skills. It will also improve your roleplaying in every style of game.

boardgame.name: MYFAROG (3rd Ed.)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

MYFAROG (Mythic Fantasy Role-playing Game) is a fantasy role-playing game, with a setting based on European mythology, religion and fairy tales. The 3.3 edition is a MAJOR overhaul of the system, with numerous dramatic changes and fixes, compared to previous editions. The rules are very modular, meaning you can play the game rules light or rules heavy, as you please. The rules are designed to make sense, and to give the players the ability to immerse themselves in Thulê; a highly credible fantasy world similar to Middle-earth and the European Classical Antiquity (some places touching into the Viking Age or the Bronze Age), but yet different. In Thulê, sorcery and the ancient deities are real, and the world is inhabited by not only humans, but also elves, nymphs, dwarves, orcs, gnomes, halflings, ettins and trolls, as well as other creatures. This art-minimalistic 218 page core rule-book (with black-and-white interior) is an all-in-one rule-book, so it contains all the information you need to play the game (and to make your own adventures and campaigns) indefinitely.

boardgame.name: When Night Falls for MYFAROG
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Myth module M1, "When Night Falls", is the first official Myth (adventure) for MYFAROG. It takes the Adventurer Party to Bearhillside to find out what has happened to a missing family. Included in this Myth; a castle, ancient towers, forgotten caves and an abandoned mine.... Beware of ettins and trolls! M1 When Night Falls is made for MYFAROG 2.6!

boardgame.name: MYFAROG (4th Ed.)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

MYFAROG (Mythic Fantasy Role-playing Game) (4th edition) is a fantasy role-playing game, with a setting based on European mythology, religion and fairy tales. The rules are very modular, meaning you can play the game rules light or rules heavy, as you please. The rules are designed to make sense, and to give the players the ability to immerse themselves in Thulê; a highly credible fantasy world similar to Middle-earth and the European Classical Antiquity (some places touching into the Viking Age or the Bronze Age), but yet different. In Thulê, sorcery and the ancient deities are real, and the world is inhabited by not only humans, but also elves, nymphs, dwarves, orcs, gnomes, halflings, ettins and trolls, as well as other creatures. This art-minimalistic 218 page core rule-book (with black-and-white interior) is an all-in-one rule-book, so it contains all the information you need to play the game (and to make your own adventures and campaigns) indefinitely.

boardgame.name: 1914 Deluxe: Hell Unleashed
boardgame.description:
1914 Deluxe is an operational level hex-and-counter wargame that covers the first few months of the First World War when the German Army began its offensive into neighboring France.
The German player must decide how best to perform the initial invasion.
Should it be a direct assault across the French border, or should the assault follow the “Schlieffen Plan” of a march through a more lightly defended Belgium?
Several factors outside of the players’ control add challenges, frustration, and a high level of replayability.
Will the players be able to define their own invasion plans or will their respective “High Commands” dictate a pre-determined setup?
Will treaties be signed with neighboring states that might impact the availability of additional forces?
And what of the looming threat of action on the Eastern Front?
All these provide a variable, but accurate simulation of the First World War’s opening moves.

The game includes a huge 34” by 44” map, provided in easily printed letter- and tabloid-sized sheets (8.5x11” and 11x17” respectively), that covers the western border of France from Belgium and the North Sea to Switzerland in the south at roughly ten miles per hex.
Combat units are mostly corps, with a smattering of divisions and brigades, representing infantry, cavalry, and artillery. These pieces represent the forces of not only Germany and France, but also Great Britain, Belgium, The Netherlands, and even a couple of Italians.
The terrain depicted on the map is a challenge to navigate, with forces depending upon the use of rail lines to more quickly advance and provide the supply needed to fight.

The basis for 1914 Deluxe is the original 1914 game published by The Avalon Hill Game Company in March of 1968.
The project began as an effort to create an updated version of the original game’s ugly “painted” map that is difficult to decipher in many respects. Once completed, it was not that much of an effort to also create a new, colorful set of counters (including new informational markers) that simplifies play. It was then a short, additional step to rewrite the rules in a manner that incorporates some of the “advanced” rules, some new rules, and known errata to create a new, cohesive rules set of under twelve pages.

This updated version takes what was originally a difficult game to play, more due to its components than its rules, and provides a relatively simple, exciting, and highly replayable gaming experience. For those who prefer the original game (warts and all), they are welcome to simply use the new map with or without the new counters for a more colorful experience.

Now, YOU can refight the opening months of the First World War!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Gilded Cage
boardgame.description:
Back of the Book

A price on your Head

You've finally gotten EJ Crop off your back, but Lord Sinjin of the Golden League has put out a bounty on you so big that every assassin, pirate, ad desperate scoundrel in the galaxy is looking to cash in. If you're always looking over your shoulder for the next ambush, you'll never be able to live as normal life. It's time to settle the score, and that means setting a trap SInjin can't escape, and baiting it with something - or someone - so tempting that the crime boss can't resist.

This Starfinder Adventure Path volume concludes the Fly Free or Die Adventure Path and includes:

"The Gilded Cage," a Starfinder adventure for 1th level characters, by Jessica Catalan
Ideas for how to continue your campaign pat the final encounter, putting the crew of the Oliphaunt in charge of an EJ Corp operation or bringing them face-to-face with a mummified Kalistocrat, by Tineke Bolleman.
A gazetteer fo SMuggler's Moon, a seculded retreat for desperate criminals, by Jessica Catalan.
An archive of dangerous threats, including living tattoo guardians and the spewer, a zombie that defendsitself with deadly vomit, by Jessica Catalan, Emily Parks, and Gabriel Waluconis.
Statistics and deckplans for Risen, Lord Sinjin's personal starship, by Jessica Catalan, and the Emperor's Graveyard, possible home to the corpse of an ancient hobgoblin sovereign, by Tineke Bolleman.

boardgame.name: Planetfall
boardgame.description:
Back of the Book

Out of this World

In a previously unknown system in the Bast lies an uncharted planet, newly discovered. The heroes lead one of several groups tasked with making the planet safe for new homes. As they establish a brand-new settlement and explore the surrounding wilderness, they must contend with wild animal attacks, dissatisfied residents, and strange mysteries! Will their settlements thrive? Or will the heroes and all those who rely on them perish in this new world?

This Starfinder Adventure Path volume begins the Horizons of the Vast Adventure Path and includes:


"Planetfall," a Starfinder adventure for 1st level characters, by Ron Lundeen.
A detailed subsystem for administrating a growing settlement on an uninhabited planet, by Jason Keeley.
A toolbox featuring a player's guide for the Horizons of the Vast Adventure Path, a collection of dangerous creatures that might harass the system's new inhabitants, and a glimpse at a bufning, barren world that hides a few secrets below its surface, by Ron Lundeen, Jess Nevis, Jim Seals, and Isabelle Thorne.
Statistics and deck plans for a modular starship designed to transport settlers to new worlds, by Isabelle Thorne.

boardgame.name: Space Station Docking Bay Expansion
boardgame.description:
From the Back Cover

Cleared for Docking!

Docking sequence activated! Next time your players visit a new space station, they won't have to wait while you draw every cargo lifter and shipping container. Starfinder Flip Tiles: Space Station Docking Bay Expansion provides beautifully illustrated 6" x 6" map tiles that can be used to enhance your station with landing pads, catwalks, a refueling station, and an expansive, open docking bay to explore. Inside, you'll find 24 richly crafted, double-sided map tiles. This expansion set, along with Starfinder Flip Tiles: Space Station Starter Set, allows you to create futuristic space habitats with endless variety! So stop your sketching and start your flipping today!

boardgame.name: Freshwater Tank
boardgame.description:
Have you ever dreamed of making your freshwater aquarium? Have you ever wondered what fish you would like to keep, or what fish will go well together? Well, in Freshwater Tank, now you can. With 155 fish and 100 incidents, see for yourself what fish you would want to have and how to take care of them while having fun with friends and families; you can even create what type of community tank you would desire. So, do you want a goldfish tank, a tropical fish tank, an aggressive cichlid tank, or any other type? That's up to you to decide.

The goal of the game is to become the first person to create a compatible fish tank with 10 fish, but be careful; there you might lose some of your fish as you play. So what are you waiting? Set up your aquarium.

Players roll a die to move around the board and collect fish or cards when landing on specially marked spaces. Players learn fish facts and aquarium care in a fun board game.

—description from the designer

listing.notes: - This game is also available at Amazon, Ebay, and Walmart. - If you are not from the US and you pay for world wide shipping, we will ship your game anywhere.

Speaking of celebrations like the straight-up bash we had for our 50th issue last month, we are celebrating the return of the MCU with the LONG-overdue Black Widow film! Presenting issue 51 - featuring the Red Room and a selection of Black Widow's classic foes.

boardgame.name: The Temple of Eternally Lost Souls
boardgame.description:
From the description:

You come across a vast and labyrinthine ancient ruin. It must have been a grand place of worship once, but now it is reduced to an empty, rotting shell, putrid with the stench of decay. Yet, the gaping maw of its entrance strangely lures you in... What treasure might still be found here?

This is a D66 list of random interesting, useful and downright dangerous items. The selection is loosely based on the darkest corners of a certain Swedish furniture store.

You're suffering from a rare form of global amnesia, a total loss of memory. Your only hope of recovery lies with a group of people with the same condition and Mnemosyne, an experimental drug that allows other people access to your memories. Will you be able to help each other remember?

Will you want to?

boardgame.description:
Game Trade Magazine

boardgame.name: Lock
boardgame.description:
Lock is a two-player strategy game inspired by classics such as 'Go' which takes about 15 minutes to play. It follows the Spooky Tower Games hallmark format of being in a cloth bag, which is also used as the board for the game.

In Lock the players take it in turn to place one of their tokens on the board. When a triangle of pieces is created, one of them is replaced with a wooden block and another is removed.

When a triangle of wooden blocks is created, a 'lock' move has been made. One of the opponent's pieces is permanently locked away within this triangle. It's possible to play a 'double lock' or even 'triple lock' move.

The game is won either when you fully surround one or more of your opponent's pieces, or when your opponent has run out of pieces to place.

boardgame.name: UNO: Mario Kart
boardgame.description:
UNO Mario Kart plays like classic UNO except every card has a symbol in the bottom corner that represents iconic Mario Kart items (Mushroom, Banana Peel, Green Shell, Lightning, or Bob-omb). The items don’t do anything during normal play, but if you play a Wild Item Box Card you get to flip the top card of the deck into the discard pile and immediately use the item shown on that card. Each item has a different action:

Mushroom: Take another turn.
Banana Peel: The player who went before you has to draw two cards.
Green Shell: Any player of your choice must draw one card.
Lightning: All other players must draw one card, then you take another turn.
Bob-omb: You must draw two cards, then you can choose the color that continues play.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Video Game Theme: Super Mario Bros.

boardgame.name: Those Who Seek Death
boardgame.description:
Those Who Seek Death is a quick playing set of rules covering Asian fleet action naval warfare between the 10th and the 16th century'

The aim of these rules, which draw upon techniques and concepts from LFG’s Inferno and Glory rules has been to develop a set that focusses on the Imjin War, fought between Korea and Japan fought in the late 16th century - the era of Admiral Yi Sun Sin and his famous “Turtle Ship” - but rules, ship data and information is provided to cover earlier wars in the region back to the 10th century.

The fast play nature of the rules allows large fleet actions with multiple squadrons a side or more to be completed in a couple of hours or less.
The rules cover the main ship types involved across the period, including a number of unusual types encountered in Asian naval battles, and encompasses not only action afloat but also forts and shore-based troops.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Battle of Hansan Do (Hansan Island): August 14th-15th 1592 – A scenario for Those Who Seek Death

boardgame.name: Apocalypse Zombie: Core Set
boardgame.description:
Apocalypse Zombie Core Set is a miniature skirmish game set in the zombie apocalypse. The outbreak has spread throughout the world while many people thought it was a hoax. Before the world realized that it was indeed happening it was too late.

In Apocalypse Zombie you have two ways to play. First is quick battles that allow you to choose a character, select a mission, set up, and play. It is a fast, fun, and bloody intro into the game. The second is the campaign. In campaign mode, you are tasked with performing missions to gather supplies, rescue survivors, upgrade home base and kill boss zombies. Campaigns can last as long as you want. With 14 Missions each with variable set up and more coming the carnage can be long lasting or short and sweet. You can “win” just by killing the Butcher Zombie and saying you have settled the area enough to prosper. Or you can trudge the blood to new bosses, new buildings, and increase the scope of the world. You may use either pre- made characters for fast entry into the unforgiving world. Or you can create your own character to level and guide through the world.

Apocalypse Zombie is played with a player turn followed by the zombie turn. Zombies are pretty much automated - reacting to sight or sound. This allows for all players to be on the same side and fight and die together. Apocalypse Zombie does have options for those more combative players that bring player vs player into the game. Zombie Abilities can hinder or severely damage your attempts to survive. Players have the choice of being sneaky or going in guns blazing. It really depends on your play style.

Combat is done with rolling attack dice to see if you hit. Defense works the same way. Hit Points are tracked with Heart Tokens.

Searching is done the same way. Each building has its own search deck in Zombie Apocalypse. So searching the Clinic will give you different results then searching the Cabin.

So how about those Zombies? Well the first boss, the one that comes in the core set, is the Butcher. He is big ugly and hard to kill. You must face him in the Butcher Shop. Players should not attempt this until they are truly prepared. Along with the Butcher you get 18 Shamblers. Slow, pesky zombies that can put your survivors in a bind. Next you get 6 Brute Zombies. These big boys will ruin your day real quick.

boardgame.name: Bloodfields: Eternal Sorrow
boardgame.description:
Bloodfields is a tactical miniature combat game for 1 to 6 players. Players will build their armies paying a blood cost for each unit. Equipment and spells can also be purchased to improve the units performance or make them more versatile in combat.

Types of play vary: there is a solo mode, a co-op, a free-for-all, capture the flag, and Leslie area control.

Bloodfields Eternal Sorrow expands upon original blood fields by adding over 14 new armies and restructuring previous army play. Players can purchase miniatures from the publisher directly or purchase 3-D printable files and print their own.

boardgame.name: Tekhenu: Eurohell Design "Obelisk" 3D resources
boardgame.description:
3D Token set to replace the cardboard resource tokens for Tekhenu.

28 x 1-papyrus and 6 x 5-papyrus
28 x 1-bread, 6 x 5-bread
28 x 1-limestone, 6 x 5-limestone
28 x 1-granite, 6 x 5-granite
25 x 1-gold
16 x 1-faith

dimension 1 token ca. 1.8cm x 1cm x 1.2cm and 5 Token ca. 2.2cm x 1.1cm x 1.5cm

boardgame.name: The Rules of Everything
boardgame.description:
In this fast-paced card game, each player takes their turn picking up a card from the deck, reading out the rule and following that rule. Every player will have their own set of rules to follow, determined by which cards they pick up.
The rules on the cards consist of things like movement, speech, and memory challenges.

The more cards a player has, the more challenging the game becomes for them. However, a quarter of the deck contains beneficial cards that allow a player to gain points, drop their cards, or win the game if they have enough points.

If a player breaks a rule on one of their cards, they must pay the penalty written in red. If they don't have any points, they must drop all of their cards and start again. So stay alert and call out rule-breakers when you see them. Using the in-game decisions, players can use strategy along with their skills to win the game.

boardgame.name: Hysteria
boardgame.description:
Hysteria is a quick, compelling, rules-light social deduction game for 6-9 players. Trying to solve the mystery is about what you think you know and who you think you trust. The Dia de los Muertos theme provides a compelling narrative for gamers of all ages.

There are two unique gameplay hooks that make Hysteria an exciting game for players of any experience level. First, players may actively switch teams during the game. This allows people who don't like being deceptive a chance to choose a different team. Second, every player has to rely on information that has been filtered through other players' memory and intention. Is someone suspicious or just forgetful?

Hysteria is played with a small row of cards face down in front of each player. The game has three rounds each played in two separate phases: The Information Phase and the Capture Phase. During the Information Phase, players get new cards, pass cards, and share information honestly or deceptively. During the Capture Phase, players attempt to convince others of what they have seen! The game ends after the third round is complete. Capture the Human cards to win!

boardgame.name: Underland
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Underland is a puzzle game where you need to get two astronauts who returned to Earth to find everyone has moved underground. Each level presents you with an obstacle course you need to navigate to get the astronauts to the elevator in order to descend to the next level. There are various pieces of equipment that can be used to assist in tunneling to the elevator while avoiding pools of acid.

boardgame.name: The Warlock Returns - Issue #04 (Q2/21)
boardgame.description:
From the rear cover

This issue brings you new material for fans of the Advanced Fighting Fantasy Roleplaying game and the Fighting Fantasy gamebooks.

Published four times a year, this issue contains:

Denizens of the Pit - Creating island creatures on Titan
Jungle - Shamanism within the jungles of Titan
Troika! Deep-Dive & Review - A look at the AFF inspired roleplay game
Sorcerer Spell Cards - For use with your magic users
Director advice articles suggesting rumours and plot hooks
Everyone-Games - An online accessibility-driven RPG convention
New Races: Slykk and the Rhino-People



The Legend of Gareus comic strip and agony aunt page*
Torra: Bringing Down the House - A location and NPCs
Letters from Arion



Plus further information on the Warlock Returns charity auction
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Denizens of the Pit: Island Creature Generator
Stellar Adventures: Torra: Bringing Down the House

boardgame.name: Underland: The Climb
boardgame.description:
User Summary

The sequel to Underland, pits Ivy in her escape from the Underland. She is being chased by aliens, but needs to use them to help trigger switches and allow her to escape. Similar puzzle mechanics to the first game, with a few added twists.

boardgame.name: BaristaCat
boardgame.description:
BaristaCat is a fun, simple competitive family card game for 2-6 players.

Players assume the role of barista and compete against other players to claim feline customers by fulfilling coffee orders. Each round players collect ingredient cards that can be combined to create different drink orders. There is a ‘lobby’ of 8 customers waiting for their order, and each customer card displays the type and number of each ingredient needed to craft their drink. Each customer is worth a given dollar amount based on that customers’ order, which can vary in complexity and size, and this amount counts towards a player’s point total at game end. If a player has the required ingredients to fulfill a customer card on their turn they claim that customer towards their total score!

In addition to ingredient cards, players have the chance to draw special cards that may help them, or may disrupt the plans of their opponents. The game ends when any player has claimed a total of 10 customers, and the player with the highest customer points wins!

boardgame.name: Feuding Foodies
boardgame.description:
Partner up with your favorite buddy and face off against other teams in this wacky card game where players race to collect ingredients and cook recipes. The first team to build enough recipes to gain 12 points wins! Feuding Foodies caters to 4, 6 or 8 players.

Each turn, draw an ingredient card face up. Pay attention to what your co-chef and competitors add to their hand. You CAN'T tell anyone what ingredients you have unless a power allows it.

Then, play an ingredient's power from your hand. POACH your neighbor's reserves with an egg, PEEL AWAY their defenses with banana, BATTER UP with flour to draw more cards, and more - the choice is up to you!

Once you and your co-chef have enough ingredients, build recipes to gain points. But pay attention at all times! Special cards can be played at ANY time and are very powerful. Use ODOR BLOCK to thwart attacks, JAM a recipe so it can't be cooked, or incite chaos with the DEVILED EGG.

Feuding Foodies is sure to be a game that has players coming back for a second serving.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Kickstarter edition Price in US$ Purchaser responsible for cost of shipping and handling (via Canada Post). Prefer to use Interac e-transfer for Canadian transactions and Wise.com for international funds transfers. (Low/no service charges) Payment with PayPal available for additional 6% surcharge (to cover service/exchange fees).

boardgame.name: Morty Corgi's Acid Shanties
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb
Ahoy and Avast!

Morty Corgi continues his work in his Scroll of Mysteries by cataloguing his time in the Acid Sea. Morty Corgi's Acid Chanties is a new supplement for Pugmire, Monarchies of Mau, and Pirates of Pugmire. Inside, you will find a large variety of material, offering new and exciting tools for players and Guides alike. As with Morty Corgi's Scroll of Mysteries, you will find a love letter from diverse and varied creators to Canis Minor. The assembled creators have crafted our offerings with care and thoughtfulness to offer expansive options for this setting that we positively adore.

We hope you have as much fun adding these materials to your game as we have had making them.

Morty Corgi’s Acid Chanties is an expansion for Pirates of Pugmire and includes:


New Families, Nestes, and Callings
New Backgrounds
New Treasures
New Locations, Ships and Crew
New Enemies and NPCs to populate your Pirates of Pugmire campaign.

boardgame.name: Neverheim: Path of Destruction
boardgame.description:
Set in a Nordic universe, Neverheim was established as an experimental planet by the gods! All the races from the realms were put together on one planet to see what would happen! They didn‘t realise what chaos would be created…

In this tactical minatures game Champions from many realms go head to head in battle or team-up to take on the enemy. In this game, your footing can be the difference between success & failure! An extensive cooperative campaign for 1-4 players set in an apocalyptic dystopia.

The Goddess of Death has raised the Army of the Dead & infiltrated the realms with carnage and corruption. Team-up with gods, giants and champions from across universe and unlock the power to overcome this zombie apocalypse! Throughout the campaign you will be levelling-up constantly to become more and more powerful as you progress while the battles get bigger and bigger!

This game has RPG elements and there is multiple towns where you will find blacksmiths, alchemists, mystics, healers, tradesmen etc. Familiars add another level to the combat and can be a ferocious companion. An in-depth experience with multiple game modes and rich lore to discover!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Fallen World: A Fantasy Skirmish Game
boardgame.description:
A war destroyed the worlds civilisations and made the control of magic impossible, you command a small force of survivors looking for revenge on those they see as responsible for the destruction or just trying to live for a few more days.

Ideal for 28mm figures but any scale will do as long as they are individually based each player will normally command about 10 figures though this could be changed if required.

Turn Sequence:

Randomly determine which side moves first and stick with this sequence for the whole game.
The players alternately move figures when a figure is activated it conducts any movement, shooting or melee before moving on to the next figure.
Once all figures have been activated roll on the random events table before starting the next turn.


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 43 - Sep 2003)
boardgame.description:
Game Trade Magazine
Issue No. 43
September 2003

boardgame.name: Iro
boardgame.description:
In the two-player strategy game Iro, you win by moving one of your pieces to the opponent's starting row, but the movement of each piece is dictated by the colors on top of it.

To set up, each player arranges six tiles in front of them; tiles are divided into 2x2 grids, with the four spaces of the grid each being in a different color: blue, red, green, and yellow. Arrange the tiles in a rectangle six spaces wide and four deep, with a space of each color in the row closest to you. Place 12 of your 16 pieces on the two rows closest to you, with the remaining pieces going into a reserve. Each piece shows three different colors or one color twice and a second color a single time. Once you've done this, reveal your set-up and place your tiles against the opponent's to create a board eight rows deep.

On a turn, you have two options:


Swap: Swap one of your pieces on the board for a piece in your reserve.
Move: Move one of your pieces on the board 1-3 spaces, with moves being orthogonal or diagonal. The spaces that you move on must match the colors of that piece, and you can land on a color only as many times as the number of times that color appears on the piece. You can move onto a space occupied by your own piece, but you can't end your move there. If you land on an opponent's piece, place that piece in the opponent's reserve and end your movement.


If you land one of your pieces in the row closest to the opponent, you win.

listing.notes: Direct sale from Designer. Price does not include shipping / VAT / Customs / Import tax

boardgame.name: Flushin' Frenzy Overflow
boardgame.description:
In this kid's skill-and-action game, players attempt to be the last player standing by catching flying poop. Players take turns rolling the die and the flushing the toilet the number of times shown on the die. This causes the water level in the toilet to rise slowly. At some point it will "overflow", causing all the poops to go flying in the air. Players race to grab a poop. If you end up empty-handed, you're out of the game. Play continues until there is only one player left, who is declared the winner.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Rolf: NSFW Expansion
boardgame.description:
This is a 25-card expansion pack for the party game Rolf. It contains bad words, so it's not safe for work, and it's not appropriate for children.

If you're not offended easily, just shuffle the cards in this box with the Rolf cards from your base game, and you're ready to play.

Just be sure you remove them when you're done playing so they don't fall into the wrong hands.

boardgame.name: Rolf: Kickstarter Expansion
boardgame.description:
This is a 25-card expansion pack for the party game Rolf. It was created by our Kickstarter backers, whom we love deeply.

Just shuffle the cards in this box with the Rolf cards from your base game, and you're ready to play!

boardgame.name: Rolf: Beer & Board Games Expansion
boardgame.description:
This is a 25-card expansion pack for the party game Rolf. It was created by Matt Sloan, Aaron Yonda, and the fans of their show, Beer & Board Games.

Although everyone should be a fan of the show, it's not required to enjoy this expansion. Just shuffle the cards in this box with the Rolf cards from your base game, and you're ready to play!

boardgame.name: Interrogation
boardgame.description:
Interrogation is a hilariously tense trivia game where players must answer questions while under a slowly descending string of dripping goo.

Players divide into two teams. One player from each team acts as the Interrogator and another player acts as the Subject. The Subjects from each team lie on the floor, side-by-side, looking up at the slime crane - a device made up of a rotating arm holding a syringe filled with green slime. The slime slowly begins to ooze from the syringe. Taking turns, the Interrogators quickly draw a card and read the question aloud to their teammate. If they answer correctly, the Interrogator gets to move the crane into position over the other team's Subject. Play continues in this manner until one player ends up with a face full of slime.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Unsolved Case Files: Jamie Banks
boardgame.description:
NOVEMBER 11, 1994: The quiet Massachusetts town of Verona was rocked by the apparent suicide of a local 18 year-old high school student.

Police ruled the death a suicide but Jamie Banks did not commit suicide. She was murdered!

Your job is to unravel the mystery of what happened on that morning of November 20, 1992 by reviewing the evidence in the investigator's original case file. The file includes articles, photos, witness statements, mugshots, suspect interrogations and more.

To crack the case, you must solve 3 objectives by answering questions on the game's website. After each objective is completed, you will be able to open a bonus envelope containing extra evidence.

The games in the Unsolved Case Files series are cooperative games and can be played by individuals, couples or larger groups.

boardgame.name: Noah Planet
諾亞星球
boardgame.description:
In 20120, World War VI broke out, the Earth was devastated in the war between humans ...

A group of scientists reserved and sorted out the data for Biological Information and Aerospace Technology for the past hundreds of years, and they assembled the leaders around the world, managed to evacuate from mother Earth before it went to its very end.

They moved to a planet, tens of thousands light-years away, a new planet they found and have been observed for a while, full of resources — air, water, sunlight and soil — required by creatures, and no life forms existed yet.

The leader of the scientists — Dr. Rookie, the Chief Biologist — brought their research result to you: a mysterious capsule, with the secret power to construct all the life forms in history, and told you:“This is the first and only one planet we ever found that has the potential to construct the whole new ecosystem on it, we call it Planet Noah. Only by constructing a new ecosystem on this planet can we reconstruct our home. Use this capsule carefully, bring us a brand new path to a better future for all humankind!”

With the result the scientists researched for hundreds of years, you jumped off from the spaceship with your fellows. You looked at each other, took a deep breath for the heavy responsibility on your shoulders. You and your fellows need to create different ecological chains, for the future of planet

Noah Planet is a 30 minute, easy to learn game that’s great for families and gamers. Players are looking to build up a new ecosystem on a new planet called Noah Planet.

Players will have a hand of cards, a deck to draw from and a tableau where they will place different species and connect different food chains to earn points. Each species card must match what that species needs in order to survive, with the resources provided by a species that is lower on the foodchain.

Every turn you have 3 actions in which you can manipulate your hand by drawing and discarding cards in order to get the right species for your ecosystem. The first to 100 points wins!

It’s a simple draw/play cards that challenge card management skills with a focus on nature and the beautiful diversity of species that we currently have on our own planet.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Malmsturm: Wege aus Blut und Eisen
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Getrieben, gehetzt und gefangen...

Viele Wege führen in die Welt von Malmsturm:
Geschichten legendärer Helden. Bühne tödlicher Duelle und Intrigen. Visionen der Abenteuer und Gefahren von morgen.

Jagd - Nach Reichtum und Rache
In einem Irrgarten aus Stein und Tod

Flucht - Durch Elend und Dunkelheit
In einer Stadt voller Verfall und Wahnsinn

Kampf - Gegen Menschen und Monster
In einer Arena aus Sand und Gier

Wohin soll es also gehen:
In die unerforschten Abgründe der Waismark? Zum verbrecherischen Abschaum des Imperiums? Oder gar in die tödliche Steppe des barbarischen Nordens?

Malmsturm - Wege aus Blut und Eisen präsentiert drei neue Schauplätze in der Welt von Malmsturm:
Drei Comics - jeder Schwerthieb und jeder Schädel gezeichnet von Malmsturm Illustrator Björn Lensig - erzählen Abenteuer aus der Waidmark, dem Imperium und dem Norden. Jeder Erzählung folgen Kapitel mit Beschreibungen und Hintergründen zu Schauplätzen und Personen, die als Sprungbrett eigener Abenteuer oder Charaktere in dieser Region genutzt werden können - seien es die lichtlosen Ruinen unter den Bergen der Waismark, die mörderischen Gassen der alten Hauptstadt des Imperiums oder das barbarische Grenzland der Steppe von Vigiristan!

... öffnen sich vor euch Wege aus Blut und Eisen!

boardgame.name: Blorg in the Wild West
boardgame.description:
In his previous outing (Blorg in the Midwest), teen alien Blorg lost his memory eraser in the Midwest while escaping from the FBI. Now he has returned to retrieve it, but has arrived 100 years too early, in the Wild West. Now Blorg must explore the desert and a Western town to gather suitable items to fuel his saucer back home. But the West is full of strange and hostile inhabitants...

The physical characteristics you assign to Blorg at the start of the game determine his survival abilities, and these determine the outcome of encounters through a hierarchy of different dice rolls that affect the probability of success of hiding, scaring, fighting or fleeing. The map and encounters are determined by a small deck of 18 cards, with over 10 billion different combinations possible.

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Contests: Button Shy Game Design Contests and Challenges

boardgame.name: Naked Court: The Butt-Naked Booster
boardgame.description:
Replace the 24 family-friendly Royal Cards in the base game with these Butt-Naked cards for a REVEALING new experience! Naked Court certainly celebrates you are the gender you choose to be, and thusly, the Butt Naked Booster shines new light on... delicate areas. Expect the unexpected! A rather classical depiction of nudity.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Samrajya
boardgame.description:
Samrajya board game was created to engage people about Nepali traditions, history and culture.
It follows Prithvi Narayan Shah's journey to control the Kathmandu valley and unify Nepal.

Goal of the game:

move along the treacherous path and capture the four kingdoms:
Kirtipur,
Patan,
Bhaktapur,
Kathmandu

then claim the crown.


Gameplay:
Roll the dice and move.
Cards lets players attack other players, take their cards, switch positions etc... Only 1 card can be played, before or after rolling the dice.

boardgame.name: EA SPORTS FIFA 22
FIFA 2022
FIFA 22
boardgame.description:
POWERED BY FOOTBALL

Groundbreaking new HyperMotion gameplay technology elevates every match across every mode in FIFA 22 only on PlayStation®5, Xbox Series X|S, and Stadia.

ADVANCED 11v11 MATCH CAPTURE

Xsens suits enable motion capture from 22 professional footballers playing at high-intensity for the first time. The resulting unprecedented volume of high-quality real-human movement data powers how both individuals and teams move across FIFA 22.

MACHINE LEARNING

A cutting-edge proprietary machine learning algorithm learns from over 8.7 million frames of advanced match capture, then writes new animations in real time to create organic football realism across a variety of interactions on the pitch.

FULL TEAM AUTHENTIC MOTION

Xsens suits record every touch, tackle, sprint and duel from all 22 players playing at high intensity for the first time ever, capturing data that powers over 4000 new animations in FIFA 22 to raise the footballing intensity, responsiveness, and physicality of every player in the game.

Tactical A.I.

Deeper player intelligence driven by the power of next-gen consoles gives each individual the ability to better understand both attacking and defensive formations and movement, creating a new level of tactical realism.

IN ATTACK

The ability to make up to 6x more decisions per second gives attackers more awareness of their surroundings, allows them to make smarter runs in build-up play, and lets them react to loose balls quicker.

IN DEFENCE

Rewritten defensive AI gives teams the ability to act as a tactical unit, retaining their shape to move across the pitch and cover vacant space.

ML - FLOW

Learning from more than 8.7 million frames from Advanced 11v11 Match Capture, the ML - Flow machine learning algorithm writes new animations in real-time, enabling players to better adjust their stride and running cadence on approach to the ball to control or strike it more smoothly.

KINETIC AIR BATTLES

Enhanced two player interaction technology syncs player animations, creating greater realism and responsiveness as they fight to be first to the ball. See defenders and attackers push, pull, and jostle as they rise to meet crosses, clearances, and long passes, increasing quality in headed situations and creating cleaner outcomes.

COMPOSED BALL CONTROL

Longer two-touch animations make controlling the ball more natural and fluid than ever before. Take down aerial balls with more technique, get more agility when trapping ground balls, and enjoy more strength in shielding situations to give you new ways to drive forward in FIFA 22.

PLAYER HUMANIZATION

Powered by Advanced 11v11 Match Capture, new off-ball player animations and ambient behaviour help bring on-pitch characters to life. See opponents talk, point, and direct each other based on the action, while updated locomotion matches players’ urgency on the pitch to make FIFA more realistic and immersive than ever.

Source: The Publisher Website.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 Gamescom Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee
2021 The Game Awards Best Sports/Racing Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Springster
boardgame.description: Springster offers the finest in high resolution, brilliant color graphics. Maneuver through 32 different, exciting mazes in search of the Maze Melon. Battle bad guys, collect treasures and race the clock during your perilous quest. Three skill levels insures fun for all members of the family. One or two players allowed.

boardgame.name: Astounding Adventures!: Magazine Issue #1
boardgame.description:
Astounding Adventures #1, crammed chock-full of thrills and danger!

In this issue, face The White Slavers of the Red Empire! Travel to danger with Gimbals Gillespie and the Bloody Night of the Screaming Cannibals. Fight the Screaming Corpses of the desert in Zombie Crime! Brave the dangers of The Phantom Jungle! Join Night Raven and the Secret Masters of the White Temple! Explore The Vaults of the Visigoths!

Astounding Adventures are scenarios designed for Astounding Tales, Pulp Action Library’s miniatures game of Derring-Do and bold Adventures. Six action-packed scenarios take you from the fog-shrouded streets of London to the savannahs of Africa.

Included is a guide to playing Astounding Adventures with To Be Continued…by GASLIGHT, Rugged Adventures, and .45 Adventures.

–Description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: .45 Adventure: Crimefighting Action in the Pulp Era

boardgame.name: Task Force
boardgame.description: Negotiations have failed! So your anti-terrorist Task Force is the last hope for hostage held by deadly terrorists in a highrise building. You have wire-guided missles, but the terrorists never miss when they shoot at you! You have to fire fast when they step into an open window. But look before you fire, because they shield themselves behind hostages.

boardgame.name: Fading Suns Universe Book
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

A Far-Future Passion Play

It is the sixth millennium. Humanity spread across the stars and built a republic of advanced technology and universal emancipation - and then squandered it, fought over it , and lost it. As the light of the stars began to slowly fade, a New Dark Age descended upon the Known Worlds. Then, from the ashes of war and ruin, Emperor Alexius rose to power and ushered in a new era of hope. He calls now for brave knights, wise priests, and resourceful guilders to bring his peace to all the worlds, known and unknown.

The Universe Book presents the setting for Fading Suns: its history, society, and astro-geography. Herin you will encounter nobles, priests, guilders, aliens, psychics, cyborgs, and more.

boardgame.name: Fading Suns Character Book
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

A Far-Future Passion Play

It is the sixth millennium. Humanity spread across the stars and built a republic of advanced technology and universal emancipation - and then squandered it, fought over it , and lost it. As the light of the stars began to slowly fade, a New Dark Age descended upon the Known Worlds. Then, from the ashes of war and ruin, Emperor Alexius rose to power and ushered in a new era of hope. He calls now for brave knights, wise priests, and resourceful guilders to bring his peace to all the worlds, known and unknown.

The Character Book presents the game system and player characters for Fading Suns. In the Victory Point System, each player uses a single 20-sided die and a handful of victory point tokens to enact their character's dramatic feats before the winds of fate. This book includes character creation rules for all the major factions, as well as technological equipment, starships, psychic powers, and theurgic rites.

boardgame.name: Fading Suns Gamemaster Book
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

A Far-Future Passion Play

It is the sixth millennium. Humanity spread across the stars and built a republic of advanced technology and universal emancipation - and then squandered it, fought over it , and lost it. As the light of the stars began to slowly fade, a New Dark Age descended upon the Known Worlds. Then, from the ashes of war and ruin, Emperor Alexius rose to power and ushered in a new era of hope. He calls now for brave knights, wise priests, and resourceful guilders to bring his peace to all the worlds, known and unknown.

The Gamemaster Book presents people, places, and plots for Fading Suns. Herein are guidelines for creating dramas for the player troupe and how to populate them with all manner of non-player-character allies, rivals, and foils. An example drama is included, as well as a roll-by-roll description of play.

boardgame.name: History of the Ancient Seas III: MARE NOSTRUM
boardgame.description:
Over centuries empires in the Mediterranean Seas invested in expansion of their territory, mostly peaceful by merchants and not by soldiers. There have been immense opportunities to build trading powers in the rich and fertile regions all over the Mediterranean Sea. But the moment will come when the greed for more power and wealth can only be stopped by another powerful empire at the frontiers of yours that has ambitions and plans of their own. Players will have to decide to send armies or diplomats to regions far away from their capitol to declare war or keep the peace.

The game series “History of the Ancient Seas” is the ultimate journey through these exciting times. Build new fleets in your city to explore unknown lands, conquer islands and build your own great empire.

In MARE NOSTRUM, the third and final installment in the “History of the Ancient Seas” game series, you will lead one of the great Empire: The Roman Empire, the Mighty Seafarers of Carthage, the Greek City States, Egypt or Persia.

Your goal is to become the leading empire in the Mediterranean Sea. To achieve this, you will need to build armies and fleets to increase your military might, expand trade routes, conquer islands and provinces, develop your military skills, economic efficiency and culture, while always keeping an eye on the wealth, happiness and stability of your people.

The game is played in highly interactive micro-impulses. The heart of the game system is the action cycle: The players choose one of the eight possible actions. Actions chosen by a player can’t be chosen subsequently by the next player. The number of possible actions is limited each turn.

MARE NOSTRUM is a five player game. New in this chapter of the game series is that each power has unique properties that players must use wisely to achieve advantage over their opponents.
Which god will help their people the most in the struggle of dominance in the Mediterranean Seas?

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameintegration: History of the Ancient Seas I: HELLAS
History of the Ancient Seas II: DIES IRAE
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: History of the Ancient Seas: Expansion I – New Markets
History of the Ancient Seas: Expansion II – Barbarians & Pirates
History of the Ancient Seas: Expansion III – New Armies

Starts with 3 Radiation.

Once per turn, give one of your Radiation tokens to the player with the least Radiation (other than yourself).

boardgame.name: Astounding Adventures!: Magazine Issue #2
boardgame.description:
Astounding Adventures #2 – a potpourri of thrills, chills and excitement!

In this issue you will combat the Claws of the Cat Goddess, join Gimbals Gillespie on the Island of Terror, investigate the Bride of the Mummy’s Curse, and endure a Féte Worse than Death!

Astounding Adventures are scenarios designed for Astounding Tales, Pulp Action Library’s miniatures game of Derring-Do and bold Adventures. In four action-packed scenarios you'll face Were-cats, Mummies, Nazis and the inhabitants of Little Piddlecomb.

Included is a guide to playing Astounding Adventures with To Be Continued…by GASLIGHT, Rugged Adventures, and .45 Adventures.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: .45 Adventure: Crimefighting Action in the Pulp Era

boardgame.name: Onitama: Licht und Schatten
Onitama: Light and Shadow
boardgame.description:
The third expansion for Onitama, Light and Shadow offers a new way to explore the elegant and simple game of martial tactics by introducing a new type of pawn: the Ninja! Unlike other pawns, the Ninja moves secretly, hidden from your opponent's view until they are ready to strike...

There are two ways to play Light and Shadow:

- Way of the Shadow is a symmetrical game in which each player deploys their own Ninja.

- Way of the Light is an asymmetrical game that pits one Ninja player against a traditional Onitama Master and Students player.

boardgame.name: Astounding Adventures!: Magazine Issue #3
boardgame.description:
Astounding Adventures #3, The Colossal Ape issue!

There’s only one adventure in this issue, but boy, is it a Doozie!

Travel to Skull Island and encounter Natives!, Villains!, Monsters!, Chinese gangsters! Vaudevillians! Pirates! Ninjas!

And Kang, King of the Apes! Kang, the 8th Wonder of the World! Kang, the 30 foot Wonder!

Also included are rules for large-scale combat in the worlds of Astounding Tales. Bring on the tanks, planes and big guns!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Hellbringer
boardgame.description:
Hellbringer is a SOLO-COOP Dark Fantasy Dungeon Crawler/Roguelike card game where you play as a hero venturing into the darkness of a dungeon to slay its mighty demon.

As you venture deeper and deeper in the dungeon, you will equip items, learn skills and earn attributes points by eliminating monsters, making you even more powerful.

The game's core mechanic is the Line of Sight. You will classify the enemies on the Sight Board depending on your perception in order to be able to target them.
The game is fast paced, last about 30 min per player and the set-up is simplistic.

A Kickstarter is coming soon, check the linktree down below to get notified on launch!

boardgame.name: The Sands Games
boardgame.description:
Board game in which up to four players compete in the Sands Games, which comprise 38 events in 27 sports. Win Gold, Silver and Bronze medals.

The rules are very simple but are different for every race. Some games use dice rolls ; others use dice and Tactics (event) cards to win the race. The board is double sided, providing different venues to emulate the various events.

Medals are worth different points and are hung on a board and tallied at the end. The player with the most points (based on their medal count), wins.

boardgame.name: Unsolved Case Files: Max Cahill
boardgame.description:
On October 26th, 1995, the campus of a small Georgia college, Tubman University, was shocked by the brutal murder of the newly-appointed dean of the history department.
​
The victim, Max Cahill, was working late in his office when the killer bludgeoned him to death. Despite several viable suspects, police were forced to close the case because they couldn't determine how the killer got to Max while avoiding detection by video surveillance cameras.

Your job is to solve the mystery by finding evidence that will re-open the case and convict the real killer. But who was it?

In order to solve this cold case murder mystery game you’ll need to find 3 separate clues that crack open the case. First figure out how the killer got to Max. Then disprove a key suspect's alibi and finally identify the clue that will put the real killer behind bars for the murder. With 3 different mysteries to solve in order to play the game, this case will challenge your investigative abilities.

To get past each step of the case you’ll need to visit an online answer page that requires you to prove you cracked it. If you don’t have the answer right you can keep investigating without being spoiled by the right answers.

boardgame.name: Unsolved Case Files: Jane Doe
boardgame.description:
On April 23rd, 2001, an unidentified young woman was murdered at a island rehab center for the rich and famous. Her body was found burned beyond recognition in a cabin fire.

There were only five other people on the island—an addiction counselor and four patients—but police were never able to figure out Jane Doe’s identity or who killed her.

Your job is to figure out who Jane Doe is, how she got to Del Fuego Island, and who killed her. This 2001 cold case remains unsolved.

In order to solve this cold case murder mystery game you’ll need to find 3 separate clues that crack open the case. First figure out how Jane Doe got onto Del Fuego Island. Then determine the identity of Jane Doe and finally connect Jane Doe to one of the suspects to put the real killer behind bars for the murder. With 3 different mysteries to solve in order to play the game, this case will challenge your investigative abilities.

To get past each step of the case you’ll need to visit an online answer page that requires you to prove you cracked it. If you don’t have the answer right you can keep investigating without being spoiled by the right answers.

boardgame.name: Unsolved Case Files: ​Buddy Edmunds
boardgame.description:
In the small backwoods town of Jethro, Texas on April 3rd, 1989, Buddy Edmunds—owner of Big Daddy’s Used Car Lot—was brutally murdered in his own living room.

Candy Edmunds, his bride of only three months, was wrongly convicted of his murder and spent the past 30 years of her life behind bars for a crime she didn’t commit.

Your job is to get Candy released from prison and figure out who really killed Buddy. Do you have what it takes to crack this unsolved case file?

In order to solve this cold case murder mystery game you’ll need to find 3 separate clues that crack open the case. First prove why the convicted woman must be innocent. Then disprove a key suspect's alibi and finally identify the clue that will close this case for good. With 3 different mysteries to solve in order to play the game, this case will challenge your investigative abilities.

To get past each step of the case you’ll need to visit an online answer page that requires you to prove you cracked it. If you don’t have the answer right you can keep investigating without being spoiled by the right answers.

boardgame.name: Unsolved Case Files: ​Veronica Falcone
boardgame.description:
ROBIN FALLS, CT - On August 26th, 1947, celebrated American WWII spy, Veronica Falcone, went missing while investigating something mysterious in town. Three months later, her motorcycle was found at the bottom of a ravine with the brake line intentionally cut.

Her boyfriend and mechanic, Joey Caruso, was arrested for the murder but hanged himself in jail while awaiting trial.

Did he kill Veronica? What was she investigating?

Can you bring about justice for this famous war heroine?

In order to solve this cold case murder mystery game you’ll need to find 3 separate clues that crack open the case. First reopen the case by proving Veronica didn't die the way investigators claimed. Then find the victim's body and finally identify the killer and close this case for good. With 3 different mysteries to solve in order to play the game, this case will challenge your investigative abilities.

To get past each step of the case you’ll need to visit an online answer page that requires you to prove you cracked it. If you don’t have the answer right you can keep investigating without being spoiled by the right answers.

boardgame.name: Unsolved Case Files: Avery & Zoey Gardner
boardgame.description:
DAVENPORT, OR - At 4:23 this morning, a man broke into a remote lake house where 19 year-old twins Avery and Zoey Gardner were asleep. The unidentified man murdered Avery and abducted Zoey before first responders could arrive.

Police departments across two states are hunting for Avery’s killer and her twin sister Zoey, but neither has been found.

Homicide detective, Angie Cullen, made a breakthrough in the case but then mysteriously disappeared. She left her detective’s notebook behind but authorities aren’t sure what to make of it.
​
The killer is on the loose. Can you solve the case and get to Zoey, and also find the detective, before it’s too late?

In order to solve this active murder mystery game you’ll need to find 3 separate clues. First find out who the accomplice is. Then identify the killer. And finally, save Detective Cullen. With 3 different mysteries to solve in order to play the game, this case will challenge your investigative abilities.

To get past each step of the case you’ll need to visit an online answer page that requires you to prove you cracked it. If you don’t have the answer right you can keep investigating without being spoiled by the right answers.

boardgame.name: Unsolved Case Files: Honey The Bunny
boardgame.description:
Rolling Hills, MO: As if being the new kid in 6th grade isn't hard enough, you have just been accused of stealing Honey the Bunny, the beloved class pet in Ms. Hartwell’s room. You swear you didn't touch him but Principal Stern won't listen.

He is about to close the case and assign your punishment when Principal Stern needs to tend to an emergency and leaves you alone in his office. As the door shuts behind him, your eyes veer over toward his desk, where the case file for his principal’s investigation into the missing bunny lies.

Can you prove you are innocent before he returns? Find the real bunny thief? Maybe even save Honey’s life and become the hero of Ms. Hartwell’s class?

In order to solve this mystery game, you’ll need to complete 3 separate objectives. First, prove your own innocence in the case. Second, identify the bunny thief, and third, find Honey. With 3 different mysteries to solve in order to play the game, this case will challenge your thinking skills as well as your investigative abilities.

To get past each step of the case you’ll need to visit an online answer page that requires you to prove you cracked each objective. If you don’t have the right answer, you can keep investigating without your task being spoiled by the right answers.

boardgame.name: Schnapper-la-papp!
boardgame.description:
All players play simultaneously. Each of the 36 tiles has symbols on both the front and the back. There is never a duplicate symbol on either side. One player rolls the dice, which tells the players which of the symbols is being searched for in this round. Now all players may quickly grab two tiles with each hand for one! Then it is checked who has grabbed the right tiles. The players take these as points. With two game variants, the game can also be played with older children to make the game a little more interesting.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Mini Mind
boardgame.description:
A dog, a cat, a mouse, a fish, a parrot and a penguin sit on a bench next to each other, the players have to find out in which order the animals sat down. Each player places one set of animals on their stand and places the second set of animals face up in any order.

Whoever's turn it is asks his teammate for the place of an animal, you may only name two animals and ask for left or right, the teammate must answer yes or no correctly, the player rearranges his openly lying tiles accordingly. For a "yes" you may ask a second question. The player who thinks he knows the correct order says it. If it is correct, he has won. If you say the wrong sequence for the third time, you lose the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: NumNum: Das Kartenspiel
boardgame.description:
Mau Mau variant with numbers - everyone starts with 7 cards, the cards carry numbers and symbols, same symbols means same suit. The player whose turn it is tries to discard as many cards as possible, same symbol on same symbol or a prohibition sign, thus blocking a 1x1 row or discarding a card that has a 1x1 row in common with the top card of the discard pile, i.e. has a common divisor. 1s are jokers, wish cards ditto, with them you can determine the symbol for the next player. If the number and symbol match, the player may discard another matching card, as long as he has double matching cards. If you can't discard, you draw a card, if you have no cards left, you win. Remaining cards can be counted as minus points in several games.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Turf
boardgame.description:
At the beginning, each player receives 150 marks, 3 green chips, 3 red chips and a betting slip. The race goes over different distances. Each player bets on the outcome of the race (win bet, place bet or run-in bet). The horses are moved according to the number of points scored. The green chips are acceleration tokens, the red ones are deceleration tokens. The winner is the one who has the most money after the winnings have been paid out.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Moskitojagd
boardgame.description:
Place the eight plastic mosquitoes in the center of the table, with their spikes facing up. The first player picks up a fly spatula. Then he is blindfolded. Zack! Blindfolded, he now strikes only once and tries to catch as many mosquitoes as possible. The mosquitoes caught are counted and credited and the next player takes his turn. The player who has managed to catch the most mosquitoes after a set number of rounds is the winner.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Fading Suns Faction Book
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Yearning to Rise

The Royal Houses, the Church, and the Merchant League conspire to control all avenues of power. Despite centuries of rules, they just can't manage it all. A number of minor noble houses still exist, clinging to dwindling fiefs and fading titles, resisting other houses' attempts to subsume them. Smaller orders and sects strive to gain converts among the forlorn, forgotten, and heretical. Minor guilds eke out livings beneath the shadows of the League giants, selling wares and services the big guilds ignore. And some among these minor factions are aliens: the simian gannok, the ungulate shantor, the avian etyri, amphibian oro'ym, insectoid ascorbites , and reptilian hironem. In the Pax Alexius, any one of them might yet rise above their rivals and claim a voice in the fate of the empire.

The Faction Book presents the minor houses (from Eldrid to Xanthippe), minor sects (from Chorali to Preceptors), and minor guilds (Apothecaries to Wranglers) of the Fading Suns universe. Herein also are the Pagans (Zuranists and Gjartins), the sentient alien species of the Known Worlds (from ascorbites to shantor), and the Changed, the genetically altered mutants scorned by the superstitious populace for their wonderous endowments.

boardgame.name: Venture: Debunking
boardgame.description:
The first Venture expansion is coming with new cards and additional rules!

Players pick a card, can play action cards and complete a mission (if possible). The player who completes all missions first is the winner



In arrivo la prima espansione di Venture con nuove carte e regole aggiuntive!

boardgame.name: Siren's Watch

Set in a rough sea, this lighthouse has saved many lives

Siren's Watch is a printable battemap compatible with any RPG game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Siren's Watch is a day & night set, comprising of several 30x30 battlemaps. The structure consists of a small walled courtyard and buildings, with a lighthouse tower. Set on a small rocky island, and surrounded by stormy seas. Provided with rooftop versions, day & night, and beacon on & off
