Contents: A set of 20x30 battlemaps depicting the crashed Greywing spacecraft, on a winter forest planet.
Interior and exterior versions are included, as well as recent & old crash versions

boardgame.name: Derelict Starship Wreck
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Floating somewhere in the void...

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Wargame game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map depicting a derelict space hulk

boardgame.name: Missile Silo
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Primed for war!

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Wargame game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map depicting the interior of a missile silo

boardgame.name: Smuggler Asteroid Base
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Within the secrecy of an asteroid, smugglers and pirates count their loot

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Wargame game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30 x 30 map depicting the secret base of a group of smugglers or space pirates, hidden within an asteroid

boardgame.name: Streets of New Atami
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Walk quickly!

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Wargame game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map depicting a futuristic cyberpunk city street, with a brightly neon lit buildings

boardgame.name: Lithilus Station Shipyard
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need your ship repaired after a close-run escape? You know where to go...

A printable rpg battlemap compatible with any RPG/Sci-Fi or skirmish game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset. The ship occupies approximately 30x50 tiles.

Contents: A large space shipyard station. Provided in many variants - 2 different backgrounds, interior & exterior view, and ship & no-ship versions (on all both backgrounds)

boardgame.name: The Dig Site
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An ancient ruin, long since buried in the sand - now about to be revealed!

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A pair of 20x20 battlemaps depicting an archaeological dig site in a desert, and the ruins and secrets below

boardgame.name: State Chambers & Undercroft
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A grand parliament building - let's hope no one has filled the undercroft with explosives!

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A two level 20x30 battlemap depicting a grand state chamber or council hall, with an undercroft beneath it.

boardgame.name: Marracombe Mill
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A peaceful watermill, sited beside a calm stream, with the miller's cottage nearby

A set of printable battlemaps compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A set of 20x30 battlemap depicting a watermill. The mill has several levels.

boardgame.name: The Alchemist's Lab
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Oops - I think there might be a leak...

A set of printable battlemaps compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A set of 20x30 battlemap depicting a watermill that has been taken over and used by an alchemist. Strange potions have leaked into the river, causing strange plants to grow!

boardgame.name: Dark Scrolls (Issue 3 - Apr 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dark Scrolls is a 48-page, old style Black and White RPG zine, which aims to share inspiration for new content on RPGs, not just old school, but also newer ones based on 5th edition.

In this chapter:

- A Town Generator with random tables.
- A high level dungeon, The Tomb of Heaven and Hell
- All new monsters from the dungeon with stats for 5e and OSR
- New Powerful Magic Items

boardgame.name: Monster Traditions 2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

For Pathfinder 1st edition and the Spheres of Power/Might systems, this apocrypha deals with talents specifically made for monsters. This apocrypha deals with brutish monsters that devour their foes whole, as well as granting new options for monsters that focus on ranged combat.

boardgame.name: Origin Heritage
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Conventional heritages focus on an individuals biological or mythological ancestry. An origin heritage shifts the focus to the place in which an individual was born and raised, a pervasive connection to a geographic region or a strong community.

ENVIRONMENTAL

There are eight environmental heritages, each typifying a common group of biomes:

Arboreal
Desert
Frozen
Rugged
Marine
Lowland
Subterranean
Wetland
COMMUNITY

There are four community heritages, each representing a style of community

Cosmopolitan
Maritime
Nomadic
Urban.
FEATS

Each origin heritage shares from a mix of over 100 ancestry feats, from 1st to 17th level.

Ancestral Paragons

Players can elect for their character to rely even more on their origin by investing in the Ancestral Paragon architype.

boardgame.name: Roguish Archetype: The Mountebank
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Few adventurers enjoy the reputation given to a paladin, the armored knights famed for their oaths of service to the divine and rigid codes of conduct. Naturally, though, with fame also comes pretenders who would try and take advantage of that reputation for their personal gain. Rogues who emulate the Mountebank archetype are deceivers who would simply dress the part of the crusading paladin, enjoying the fame (or infamy) which comes from these real holy warriors' deeds.

Building off of the existing Fifth Edition rules to build a rogue character, the Mountebank gives you options to build a deceptive rogue willing to disguise themselves as a traveling paladin and take advantage of the goodwill these holy warriors experience.

boardgame.name: The Queen & The Corrupter
boardgame.description:
When King Arthur traveled beyond the waters of Britain to fight the Emperor of Rome, Queen Guinevere was left alone.

Arthur’s nephew Mordred, had plans of his own, not only for the crown of Brittany, but to kill poor Guinevere, by law or by by force. Little did he know that Guinevere was concocting her own devious scheme, to stop the Corrupter’s game before he took his chance to sit on the throne.

As Arthur battled against the legions of Rome, the corrupt and bitter feud back home to him was unknown. Until one fateful day he heard. The death of a family member, but it had seemed so absurd.

Had Mordred the Corrupter triumphed, or had Queen Guinevere managed to defend the throne?

The Queen & The Corrupter is a 2 player social deduction and memory card game, which sees you playing as either Queen Guinevere or The Corrupter Mordred in a battle of wits for the throne of Brittany.

Each round, both players draw their subjects, and then choose which subject cards from their hand to play to the council, taking turns to reveal them, claiming influence from the council and enacting their subject's orders as they do.

The trick is in remembering which subject you have played to which advisor, and in correctly timing your moves in order to vanquish the other player by revealing the Assassin or the Executioner with the correct influence, in turn winning the game.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Theme: King Arthur / The Knights of the Round Table / Camelot

boardgame.name: OverDrive
boardgame.description:
It’s time to hit the arena, Coach! Draft your team and get ready to face-off in one of six different action-packed game modes. Pass the bomb, capture the flag or fight to become king of the hill - but knowing when to unleash your players’ powerful OverDrive move will be key to coming out on top. Whatever you do, don’t go down without a fight!

OverDrive features an exciting drafting mechanic that means you never quite know what Players you’ll have on your team each game. Take it in turns to choose the Players you want in your roster to create your dream team before heading into the arena. Advanced drafting rules open up even more tactics as both Coaches vie for their favourites!

On their turn a Coach activates one of their players and moves them around the arena to try and score or knock out an opponent. Dice rolls are required for tests, like Slams or Dodges.

The game ends after 8 Rushes (turns) or if one Coach reaches eight points. {layers win the game by reaching eight points or having the highest score at the end of eight Rushes (turns).

OverDrive features an innovative tug of war scoring system that means the lead can quickly pass between Coaches. A good turn can mean you’re suddenly back in the game, while poor tactics can give your opponent the edge.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: OverDrive: Coach Abilities and Sponsorship Cards
OverDrive: Rival Pack – Tigrax vs Shadow

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes:
Played once, in very good condition. Miniatures have been glued onto the acrylic bases unpainted, a bit of fogging on the acrylic from the glue.
Contact me for shipping costs.
Title: OverDrive Publisher: Mantic Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: The Silence of Dawnfell
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Silence has fallen over the town of Dawnfell. The enchanted ringing of Frostchime, the sacred bell that wards away the clan of wild trolls in the Biting Woods, has vanished. Now Dawnfell is open to vicious attacks - how long can it last?

The Silence of Dawnfell is an Adventure Module for 4-6 Level 1 characters, to be used with the Against the Darkmaster Core Rules.

boardgame.name: Crash and Burn
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The crew of the Oliphaunt have been living the good life, riding high after robbing a Kalistocracy commerce barge. But when old enemies join forces, the crew loses it all—their fortune, their reputations, and even the Oliphaunt itself! Now they're trapped on Absalom Station with nothing but the clothes on their backs. They'll have to cash in every favor, rely on every friend they've ever made, dodge bounty hunters and assassins, and rebuild a junk starship that barely flies if they hope to catch their enemies and reclaim what's theirs!

"Crash and Burn" is a Starfinder adventure for four 9th-level characters.

boardgame.name: Underwater Cities: Meeple Source 147 Piece Wooden Upgrade Set
boardgame.description:
This wooden upgrade set includes:

Small Science (x15)
Large Science (x10)
Small Biomatter (x15)
Large Biomatter (x10)
Small Kelp (x15)
Large Kelp (x10)
Small Steelplast (x15)
Large Steelplast (x10)
1 credit (x20)
5 credit (x10)
10 credit (x5)
12 submarines (4 designs, 3 for each player)

boardgame.name: Underwater Cities: Meeple Source 112 Piece Wooden Upgrade Set
boardgame.description:
This wooden upgrade set includes:

Small Science (x15)
Large Science (x10)
Small Biomatter (x15)
Large Biomatter (x10)
Small Kelp (x15)
Large Kelp (x10)
Small Steelplast (x15)
Large Steelplast (x10)
12 submarines (4 designs, 3 for each player)

boardgame.name: 1000 Stories
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This game is about group story-making for everyone.

We created this super simple RPG for the classroom. It was part of a larger project of retheming games as a learning activity. The goal was to make a game that players could simply start playing, without any explanation of rules. Of course, the Guide (running the game), would need to know a few rules in advance.

The current edition has rules for creating characters and resolving actions using just two six-sided dice. Sample characters and a sample scene are provided for plenty of examples. Printable character sheets have an Attempt track on them and a Difficulty/Action track is also provided. The tracks are a visual tool designed to make dice rolls intuitive for players new to RPGs. A very short summary card is also provided.

No setting is given. Stories could take place in real world, historical settings as an exploration for a lesson. A Guide could make a Story in any setting imagined. Tips for creating and running a Story are included.

boardgame.name: 1000 Stories Supplement 1: Conflicts and Competitions
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This booklet is a supplement for the 1000 Stories role-playing game. That book is required to actually play the game. This supplement introduces options for using opposed rolls to determine the outcome of events that pit characters against each other.

Like the core rules, everything is meant to be light on rules and intuitive. It is designed with classroom use in mind.

boardgame.name: You + 1000 Stories
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This single page sums up how to use 1000 Stories with the setting from You: The Role-Playing Game of Tomorrow - 20th Anniversary Edition.

boardgame.name: Juvenile Delinquents
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Juvenile Delinquents is a role playing game set in the epic tales of our youth and by playing it we are able to reminisce and share our youthful exploits with our friends. It was designed to be simple and easy to play. Characters are created by purchasing abilities from a fixed amount of points. Task [sic] are resolved using a single roll of a twenty sided dice. And there are no complex tables, formulas, or other listings. In addition, provisions have been included which allow players and referees to add more detail if they wish.

boardgame.name: クロ密 (Kuromitsu)
boardgame.description:
In クロ密 (Kuromitsu), the players are creating a hybrid word-search/crossword puzzle grid, and trying to score the most points.

Each player is given a different colored pencil, and a set of categories is laid out in a circle. After some initial seeding, a player rolls a die, which determines the category of word to be added. Then, in real-time, the first player to shout out a word in the category determines the word that will be written by each player on their board. Afterwards, the papers are passed to the left, and the process is repeated.

Once a player is unable to write a word on their sheet the game ends. Each player scores points based upon how many times their colored pencil has written letters on each sheet.

boardgame.name: Escape from Riedra
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Riedra may be the land of your dreams, but the Eyes are always watching.

Journey to the distant empire of Riedra in this stand-alone Across Eberron adventure from the team that brought you the best-selling Convergence Manifesto adventure path and Eberronicon. This Tier 2 module is optimized for five 7th-level characters.

Adventure Summary: A Riedran deserter has come to the adventurers with a simple request—save her lost love from the control of the Inspired and bring her safely back to Khorvaire. Player characters must navigate the sinister surveillance state, do battle with powerful psionic foes, and resist the creeping threat of psychic assimilation.

boardgame.name: Barreling Forward
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A member of the Aurum has hired the party to heist an item recovered from the Mournland, which is destined for a Cannith excoriate’s enclave outside Fairhaven.

Rumors connect the item to the cause of the Mourning and it must not fall into the wrong hands. The right hands clearly not belonging to the rogue Cannith agents guarding it during the last leg of its journey; the Thaliost–Fairhaven lightning rail service.

In truth, the item isn’t connected to the cause of the Mourning, but is actually a warforged colossus’s master docent. The docent is dormant and fused to its last operator, Ember, a warforged who’s still alive, but badly injured. Ember doesn’t want to become a weapon of war again and poses a moral quandary for the characters; do they complete the job as asked or help Ember be free of their past? The party aren’t the only ones vying for the artifact. The Lord of Blades’ agents also descend upon the train in the midst of the heist, throwing a definite blade in the works.

boardgame.name: Duck Dodgers: The Jump
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Space, the final frontier full of great wonders, beautiful females and … ducks? That's right Jumper, with that document you can aid Galactic Protectorate in keeping space a calm place, help the Martian Empire gain advance in ongoing conflict with Galactic Protectorate or become a free crew in space trying get your own slice from that pie in the 24th and ½ century. What you're waiting for, prepare engines and blast off!

boardgame.name: Swords & Wizardry Complete Box Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Swords & Wizardry is more than a re-statement of the original rules that gave rise to 5e. It is fast-playing, easy to start, and easy to learn by anyone.

Swords & Wizardry is a snapshot of the rules as they existed in 1978 right before “first edition” was released. The fifth edition game currently played, watched and beloved by millions is great fun, but the structure of the rules has changed over the course of editions, and there’s a unique feel to the earlier versions of the game which you may not have encountered before.

User summary:

Includes these core components:

58-page Referee Book
62-page Player Book
42-page Spells & Magic
60-page Monsters


Includes these additional components:

10-page Equipment Kits
28-page Magic User Spellbook
14-page Cleric Spellbook
16-page Druid Spellbook
Magic User Spell Cards
Cleric Spell Cards
Druid Spell Cards
Bookmark

boardgame.name: A Feast for Odin: Meeple Source 57 Piece Wooden Upgrade Set
boardgame.description:
This wooden upgrade set includes:

Stone Resource (x24)
Wood Resource (x32)
Moose First Player Token (x1)

boardgame.name: Birdwatcher
boardgame.description:
Birdwatcher is a fast, competitive game in which players are rival wildlife photographers on a hunt to snap photos of the elusive and illustrious birds of paradise.

Each player has three actions on their turn, with which they can call birds to their tree from the central clearing and jungle, snap photos of birds in their tree, or run into the jungle to flush new birds to the clearing. Players can also use their actions to set up a zoom lens to capture a bird from another player's tree, or to publish a paper. Photos and publications are assembled from left to right in a player's photo journal where they will score points at game's end.

boardgame.name: Like Herding Cats
boardgame.description:
It’s time to put the cats away for the night. You’re throwing a dinner party, and your best friend’s spouse is allergic!
But making cats do what you want is never as simple as it should be.

The goal of this push-your-luck, pickup-and-deliver game is to put all your cats upstairs at the same time for the night and get them to stay there while their mood swings. You do this by picking them up, but first you must distract them by appealing to their mood.
Each turn, all the cats will have their mood swings, and then move, act or react accordingly. Then, you can move around, opening and closing doors, moving toys and getting food and water where a cat will see it, and, if you played your odds right, pick up some cats to take them upstairs.

But they won't stay forever there - if they feel strongly about something, they'll come downstairs again, looking to satisfy their urges. So, you need to hurry and put all the rest away quickly.

As if that wasn't enough, your time is limited, your visits are arriving soon, and if you don't manage to get all the cats before the mood cards run out, they'll crash your party the entire night. Good luck getting your guests to enjoy their dinner..!

AWARDS
3rd place Best Overall Game in the 2021 Solitaire Print and Play Contest!!

Additionally:
- 1st place Best AI
- 1st place Best Regular PnP Build
- 3rd place Best Use of Theme
- 6th place Most Innovative Mechanics
- 6th place Best Original Art

boardgame.name: Avatar Legends: The Roleplaying Game Quickstart
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This quickstart is a preview of Avatar Legends: The Roleplaying Game, including the basic mechanics of the game, information on how to create a character, guidelines on running the game, an adventure with six pre-generated characters tailored to the situation, six blank playbooks if you’d like to create your own character, and more. You’ll find everything you need to start playing the game and run through the adventure we’ve included!

boardgame.name: Chambers of the Serpent Folk
boardgame.description:
Made for new and experienced players, every Epic Encounters set features an all-in-one boxed encounter that’s fifth edition compatible and ready to play.

An Epic Encounters warband box containing 20 highly detailed serpent folk minis, Chambers of the Serpent Folk will send you stumbling into an ancient plot.

Long ago, the Serpent Folk ruled the world. Now, their forgotten temple echoes with the screech of sarcophagus lids shoved aside as their scaled hands emerge. Now, they are awake. And they are wanting. Can you stop them before they reclaim the world that was once theirs?

Use Chambers of the Serpent Folk as a standalone encounter or as part of a new or existing RPG campaign. Feeling brave? Then combine this set with the boss box, Temple of the Snake God, for a truly epic experience!

- Back of Box Text

boardgame.name: Ravagers of Ruins
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

More Things To Kill

This book is a fully illustrated bestiary of 34 new monsters dwelling in ruined cities, for parties of level 1 or higher.

Also featuring : Rules for creating your own classes for animal folk characters!

Sample beastfolk: Cat Folk, Crocodile Folk, Hare Folk, Hound Folk, Mouse Folk, Mosquito Folk, Sheep Folk, Spider Folk and the endearing Swine Folk.

Rules to generate maps and content for Ruined Cities.

Tables for special features, treasure and magic rings.

New spells to be used in game-mastered games under the “RPG-Lite Option”.

boardgame.name: The Bone Cult of Tha'ar Tala
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Lives of Children Hang in the Balance

The outlawed Bone Cult of Tha’ar Tala has kidnapped children from the streets of Paraxi, to use them in their dark rites. Your party is hired to save the children and clean out the cult. Rumor has it that they are hiding in a ruined temple of Elidra, near a forest a few miles from town.

This is a four-chapter adventure for a Four Against Darkness for characters of all levels.

boardgame.name: Monsters of the Mind
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The colony of Taevelos has gone silent and nobody knows why and the Galactic Earthlings Union can't let the Sector capital go univestigated. Play as a team of rescuers who go to the planet and find what truly caused the planet to go silent.

boardgame.name: Shelter for monsters and man
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Here are some new properly made maps for fantasy games. The scale corresponds to 1 square = 5 feet measure. It can also be used for minies, or regular storytellings.

boardgame.name: The Herbalist's Hospitum
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Be a guest in the herbalist's hidden deep forest Shelter. Six page of maps and artwork of this unique building. Equipped with a 5 feet combat grid it's a great place to drop your plot.

boardgame.name: ThunderZine (Issue #3)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the ThunderZine, the support 'zine for all of Kyoudai Games brands, including the Infinity's Edge Role-Playing Game, the Tiny Legacies line of sourcebooks for Tiny Supers, and Thunderscape in all its many forms!

The ThunderZine is developed for and with the members of the Kyoudai Games Patreon, who get it several months in advance of the public and who have the opportunity to contribute ideas and requests for specific content.

In this third issue:

Firearm rules for Infinity's Edge!
The starter zone of Shepherd's Rest for Infinity's Edge!
An examination of how the Prestige Traits from Tiny Dungeon, 2nd Edition fit into the world of Aden for Thunderscape TinyD6!
The College of Astromancy, a new option for Archmages in Thunderscape TinyD6!
In Random Heroes for Tiny Legacies, we meet the Crimson Gargoyle!
And finally, an examination of the Universal Wardens, an intergalactic peacekeeping agency in the world of Tiny Legacies, complete with an alternative archetype!

boardgame.name: Planedawn Orphans
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Planedawn Orphans is a campaign kit that helps you prepare a campaign for the fantasy role-playing game of your choice. It provides a flexible and versatile framework to start a campaign. The campaign kit will help you get started, but some assembly is required.

Stranded between the planes

Set in the Planar City, a strange melting pot that connects the vast diversity of the multiverse. You all play Planar Orphans stranded in this city, your original home worlds destroyed, corrupted or lost.

A mysterious Patron has brought you together, provided you with a base of operations and tasked you to complete a Planar Key. This key will let you create a new plane for you and your fellow refugees. Your quest will bring you to exotic places filled with strange creatures and bizarre phenomena.

This book is a campaign kit. It presents a structure and a collection of ideas that will help you plan your own campaign. Contrary to a predefined campaign, this leaves a lot of empty space for the GM and the players to fill.

We designed the core elements of the campaign (the orphans, the patron, the home base and the key) so that they provide maximum flexibility: Drop-in and drop-out play, a lot of variety in your missions, a focus on action rather than travel and even rotating GMs.

Campaign Benefits
Flexible for drop-in drop-out play
A medium to long-running campaign
Easy access to a wide variety of strange planes and exotic locales
Highly varied character backgrounds and concepts are possible
A clear goal and a way to measure campaign progress
Can accommodate multiple rotating GMs

boardgame.name: Night of Madness
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An ancient evil is discovered and the Kingdom is threatened!

In this campaign of five interlinked adventures for the Warlock! roleplaying game inspired by the early days of British tabletop gaming, the characters are drawn into a plot to unleash an ancient evil over the Kingdom, and bring the world of man to its knees. Through desperate battles, stealthy rescues and in the depths of lost catacombs, can the adventurers outwit their foes and stop the unleashing of the night of madness?

boardgame.name: Liber Genus XII: Oozefolk
Oozefolk
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Have you ever looked at a creature and thought, "hmm, that would be interesting to play"? Have you thought it a shame that some creatures look like you could walk down the street in your game as one yet there are no hard rules on how to do that? Well the Liber Genus series aims to fill that niche.

This twelfth installment brings the slimey oozefolk to the table, with rules on how to create a character as a versatile ancestry. Incorporating 4 heritages based on several types of ooze you could resemble as well as 11 ancestry feats and 1 magical item.

boardgame.name: The Maze of Mezeria (WWN)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Brave the Maze of Mezeria! There is but one chance for glory, but many for death. Venture forth with skill and guile or join the doom of a long dead civilization.

The Maze of Mezeria is a 60-page adventure for Worlds Without Number. Your players will explore a labrynith full of secrets while fighting for their very survival. The Maze of Mezeria works best for 1st or 2nd level characters.

In this adventure you will find;

New backgrounds for Worlds Without Number, including the Pirate, Grave Robber, Initiate, and the Explorer;
A 60-page adventure that should last 10-20 hours depending on playstyle;
A fully keyed map of the Maze of Mezeria;
New adversaries, including Blobs, Cannibals, Minotaurs, and more;
A full adventure summary, keyed for quick reference at the table

boardgame.name: Means of Production
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Flotilla Refuse

In a lost future, the world is covered by an endless ocean.
For the people who call the Junk Flotilla of Refuse home, life on the Lost Sea are marked by brutality and greed. Caught between the warring mega cites of Flotilla Oceania and Flotilla Pacifica, the refugees need all their skill, tenancy, and courage to survive the Drowned War.

Means of Production

A rep for the Diver Lords hires the Party to find the source of a rival's small parts operation. When they discover the means of production, they stumble onto a primal horror.

boardgame.name: The Wizard's Tower Issue 1: The Replicamancer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You have stumbled into the unknown. In the distance, you see a tower. You decide to investigate.
What follows is a simple, OSR-inspired, system to describe a Wizard’s Tower. It is designed to be incorporated into your campaign world, using the rules you feel like using.

The wizard was an expert in not only creating new life, but duplicating it. However all his clones left him. His ballads, lamenting his lost pals, have drawn a terrible devil. Can the PCs survive the mysteries of the tower?!

boardgame.name: The Wizard's Tower Issue 02: The Arachnomancer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The adventurers put their feet up for a well-deserved break in a nice warm tavern. Tonight, however, the taps run dry. Not on their watch!

What follows is a simple, OSR-inspired, system to describe a Wizard’s Tower. It is designed to be incorporated into your campaign world, using the rules you feel like using.

The wizard is a spidery spy with nefarious arachnid allies. Can the Adventurers survive the mysteries of this inverted tower?!

boardgame.name: The Oracle (Issue Zero - Jul 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Oracle Issue Zero - Fantasy Forest Themed
Just as all characters are better equipped when they have a bag of holding, a potion of healing and a sunrod, a GM is better equipped when supplied with a steady stream of new material and ideas.

And that's what we have for you here.

This month we bring you, in one fully illustrated PDF the following system-neutral Fantasy RPG material:

Contents

DM Advice - How to take lead a party through the wilderness
10 Adventure Hooks
12 Trinkets and Treasures
2 Organisations - Sisters of the Leaf and Fire Witches
10 Things to See
12 Forest related NPCs
8 Random Encounters in a Forest
3 Creatures
5 Magic Items (plus 3 variations)
3 Festivals and Events
7 Locations
1 Forest Encounter with tactical map
1 Picture Story Prompt

boardgame.name: The Oracle (Issue 12 - Jul 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Oracle Issue 12 - Celtic Lands
Just as all characters are better equipped when they have a bag of holding, a potion of healing and a sunrod, a GM is better equipped when supplied with a steady stream of new material and ideas.

And that's what we have for you here.

This month we bring you, in one fully illustrated PDF the following system-neutral Fantasy RPG material:

Contents

Game Advice - Creating Celtic adventures, what to use, avoid and make the most of. Also what we know from history examined.
Mushroom queen - a quest giver NPC with special mushrooms and details of their effects both malicious and marvellous
The Vapours of Anwan - A druidic organisation fully detailed including key individuals
Standing Stone Generator to produce ordinary and exotic standing stone descriptions in seconds
6 Detailed NPCs with Adventure Hooks
6 Things to See - from sleeping princesses to reflected childhoods! New creatures presented
9 New Magic Items presented
Exclusive interview with Pat Mills of 2000AD fame!
Events for all seasons with story hooks
3 Unique locations including a doorway to the deadlands
20 Trinkets and Treasures
Fabulous Fairies - some content on the wee folk to give you game ideas
Picture Prompt - designed to get you thinking creatively

boardgame.name: Under Alien Skies
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Under Alien Skies expands the setting of Trinity Continuum: Aeon with details about the alien Chromatics, Coalition, and Listeners, including rules for playing characters belonging to these three species. In addition, this book provides information about six other species of aliens.

Inside, you will find:

Further information about the Chromatics, Coalition, and Listeners, including details about their lives and societies, rules for creating characters belonging to these species, and advice to Storyguides for incorporating these aliens into their chronicles.
Information on five extinct or nearly extinct aliens, including several that left behind dire threats to humanity, as well as the first detailed information about the strange and malevolent Doyen.
Advice to Storyguides for incorporating aliens into their campaigns as either species for the characters to encounter and as characters who are the heroines and heroes of their own chronicles.
Step by step instructions for creating new aliens species as either creatures for characters to encounter as well as unusual options for characters.
New technologies used by various aliens, including common devices and barely understood wonders that continue to baffle and amaze human researchers.

boardgame.name: Magento's Marvellous Waxworks (5e)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Magento's Marvellous Waxworks, a premium adventure module for a party of 3-5 players of 1st-level that will see the PCs reach 3rd- or even 4th-level by its conclusion.

The adventure tells the strange and whimsical tale of a prolific sculptor whose waxwork creations come alive and turn on him. It opens with the PCs attending an exclusive masquerade ball—either as guests or 'the help'—that is beset by bizarre wax sculptures of exotic animals which have inexplicably come to life. It then sees them journey to the strange waxwork museum of the sculptures' eccentric creator, Magento Baronus, before finally tracing the origins of the mysterious material to a nearby warehouse where the PCs are able to resolve the curious case of the wacky wax once and for all.

At a glance, Magento's Marvellous Waxworks is...

...An unforgettable, one-of-a-kind adventure with high production values
...Chock full of gorgeous illustrations and detailed maps, all exquisitely presented
...Complete with comprehensive appendices that take a deep dive into the living wax that features so prominently throughout the adventure, including guidelines for making original waxwork sculpts or converting existing creatures
...Inclusive of statistical information for 34 characters and creatures that feature throughout the adventure

boardgame.name: Zombie Mash Gruel
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

'Mmmm... Brains!'

This rather unpleasant concoction can make it safe to mingle amongst the undead, as long as you can keep the foul mix down.
And there's the outside chance it might make you a brainless zombie for a while too...

Rules included for 5E and system agnostic notes.

boardgame.name: Brightwater Class Personal Yacht
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Travel in comfort!

Unhappy with the limited yacht options of mostly larger designs, Indian robotics billionaire Arjun Giridhar decided to commission a new, smaller yacht design. He specified that the ship had to be the smallest hull possible for a Zimm capable ship, have moderate normal space acceleration, and provide very high-class accommodation for up to four passengers. Two years later, and after considerable negotiations, Paragon Industries Shipyards were chosen to design and construct Giridhar’s yacht.

Paragon requested purchase rights for the design with the intent that they could offer the yacht as a construct by commission basis for the wealthy of Clement and Earth Sectors.

And now you, too, can get one!

This book contains full deckplans for the TL12 version and the TL13 version of the Brightwater prepared by our starship guru, Michael Johnson. This is accompanied by the beautiful art of fan favorite, Ian Stead. Within these pages, you can learn about the two versions of the Brightwater, its history, and its future.

Climb aboard! The journey is always comfortable in a Brightwater!

boardgame.name: The Low Road to Braddock Dene (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A valley marks the border between two friendly territories, yet something is stirring up trouble...

The Low Road to Braddock Dene (pf2e) is a Pathfinder Second Edition Compatible one-shot adventure optimised for 4 players from level 8 and up, but easily adaptable for other levels.

Having found themselves venturing along the border between two territories, your players come across an important courier, laying prone on the ground after being attacked. They urge you to deliver the mail to the nearby frontier settlement.

The Low Road to Braddock Dene (pf2e) includes the following:

10 maps.
3 customised creatures and 2 cutomised NPCs.
Interesting backstory and multiple story hooks.
2 separate avenues into the adventure, human or orc
Multiple gameplay examples.
The option to extend the adventure using a random rumour table.
Each creature has been designed so that it can be printed as a creature card.

boardgame.name: The Low Road to Braddock Dene (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A valley marks the border between two friendly territories, yet something is stirring up trouble...

The Low Road to Braddock Dene (5e) is a Pathfinder Second Edition Compatible one-shot adventure optimised for 4 players from level 8 and up, but easily adaptable for other levels.

Having found themselves venturing along the border between two territories, your players come across an important courier, laying prone on the ground after being attacked. They urge you to deliver the mail to the nearby frontier settlement.

The Low Road to Braddock Dene (5e) includes the following:

10 maps.
3 customised creatures and 2 cutomised NPCs.
Interesting backstory and multiple story hooks.
2 separate avenues into the adventure, human or orc
Multiple gameplay examples.
The option to extend the adventure using a random rumour table.
Each creature has been designed so that it can be printed as a creature card.

boardgame.name: Alien Puppies: Cyberpunk Deck
boardgame.description:
40 cards (15 Unique Puppies) with grown-up puppies & darker Cyberpunk themes. Includes 3 Kickstarter exclusive cards. A fully playable, stand alone deck.

With the additions, There are 50+ Dog Breeds/Pups in the Cyberpunk Deck:

Frenchie, Pug, Husky, Shiba, Poodle, Dalmatian, Hokkaido, Akita, Corgi, Chihuahua, Pitbull, Shih Tzu, Leonberger, Boxer, Great Dane, Hound, Mountain, Portie, Shikoku, Dobermann, Skypoo, Border Collie, Rottweiler, Hrti, Wolfdog, Greyhound, Elkhound, Puli, Spaniel, Komondor, Shepherd, Jack Russell, Labrador Retriever, Pomeranian, Shar Pei, Heeler, Dachshund, Beagle, Sheltie, Kugsha, Cane, Pinscher, Chow Chow, Mastiff, Cocker, Papillon, Schnauzer, Newfoundland, Malamute, Whippet, Bandog, Terrier, Staffy, Otterhound.

boardgame.name: Galaxy Black IV Economics, Equipment, Gear, & Technology, Space Trader Nick's Coreworld Consultant and Frontier Survival Supply Catalog (Third Quadrant, 957th Sidereal)
Galaxy Black IV: Imperial Gear and Technology
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Technology to Exceed the Golden Age!

The Might of the Empress Imperium is founded on the doctrine of Imperial Parascience

Within it all that is possible is allowed.

Program your Immortality

Fire up the Sleep teacher

Become a different species

And dive into your Navitank

Scrounge your flat and grab your cash it’s time to go shopping voyager.


What is Galaxy Black?

Galaxy black is a science fiction and space fantasy toolkit for your DCC RPG game. A lightly gothic semi-humorous fantasy of the space future that was, and could still be, one day. With magic, bright colours, and deep implications. For everyone.

With Galaxy Black you should be able to fake your way through your favorite SF

franchise without any problems at all – from golden age space opera to grotty modern post-cyberpunk, from the gutter to the stars, and all points in between.

Galaxy black is also, for those who want it, a setting, showing one example of how using all the elements in the book (and there are a lot of them!) together can work, using a traditional golden age Galactic Empire as a model.

Galaxy black is generators! Make worlds, cultures, aliens, gods, and technology, use the campaign frameworks and adventure generators to inspire or map out a whole adventure, a whole campaign!
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: To Dream To Conquer To Rule
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The third and final part of the Triskelion cycle. Part 1 is Villains Unleashed, Part 2 is Answering the Call, and this is the third and final part. A complete adventure along with listings of additional villains and potential heroes/allies.

boardgame.name: Firefighters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“The city can be a wondrous place, but it is also fraught with danger. From fires to floods, from car accidents to collapsing buildings—whenever a citizen finds themselves trapped or in danger, they always know they can rely on the local firefighters to answer their call for help.

The fire department trains and equips its teams to protect lives and property—extinguishing fires and rescuing civilians from dangerous situations. Many firefighters are volunteers, people from all walks of life who respond to emergency calls whenever their services are needed. Others are career firefighters, working full-time for the department. But all of them are well-trained and dedicated.

You are brave firefighters, responding to emergencies, helping the community, and risking your lives to protect others. So don your gear, jump in the fire truck, and resolve the latest crisis!”

Inspired by disaster movies and tales of real-world heroes, Firefighters is a standalone scenario for the Tricube Tales system and is usable as a micro-setting, but it is also a fully self-contained one-page RPG in its own right. You can print it on a single sheet of paper: The first page includes everything you need to play, while an optional second page expands the adventure generator with examples and twists.

boardgame.name: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim – The Adventure Game
boardgame.description:
ADVENTURES IN THE WORLD OF SKYRIM!

Before the Dragonborn came to Skyrim….

You are surviving members of the Blades, a legendary group who long protected the Empire of Tamriel! Abandoned by the empire, you must work together to thwart a plot that threatens the whole of Skyrim

Build a unique character in the world of the Elder Scrolls. Choose between a Nord, Dunmer, Imperial, Altmer, Khajiit or Orsimer. Equip your character with a wide range of weapons, spells and armour. Travel across the Holds of Skyrim to places like Riften, Solitude, Falkreath and Whiterun. Attempt a huge range of evolving quests that change the game with each decision, Explore the wilderness. Gain side quests from mysterious characters. Delve into ancient ruins and tombs. Battle Draugr, Frostbite Spiders, Dragons, Dwemer Constructs and Daedra. The deeper you delve, the deadlier your foes will become. Gain experience and amazing treasures. Upgrade and enchant your gear. Level up your character with a wide range of unique skills and abilities. Play through six chapters of two huge campaigns spanning 25 years in the history of Skyrim in this endlessly replayable boardgame.

The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim – The Adventure Game is a 1-4 player co-operative game of adventure and exploration across Skyrim. Players take the roles of heroes involved in epic quests, working together to defeat their enemies and exploring the vast expanse of Skyrim. You will be able to choose character miniatures like the Khajiit, Nord, or High Elf; plan your strategy with weapons or spells; and fight your way through forgotten mines, Draugr-infested tombs, or ancient Dwemer cities to find ancient treasures and increase your power.

The players must keep an eye out as the threat increases across Skyrim as Dragons, Daedra, Trolls, and more roam the lands and wreak havoc across the holds. Players need to work together to keep the lands free, whilst balancing the demands of their most important quests.

The base game is divided into two campaigns of three chapters each. The decisions the players make from their first turn have a distinct effect on the unfolding story and encounters, making the whole campaign experience different every time you play. You can even save your progress after each game and start the next chapter with the same character, equipment, and skills.

With the numerous choices of characters, gear, magic, and skills matched with the many decisions each player makes through their quests, there are literally hundreds of hours of gameplay, with some stories not even seen based on your early decisions. The face of Skyrim can change during the game, impacting the course of the players' experience in subsequent chapters. At any time, the players can simply reset, choose another character and play style, make different choices, and experience things differently. Alternatively, pick a chapter that sounds fun and drop in to just play that adventure as a one-off.

Key mechanics:

A Living Board
The game board represents the province of Skyrim. Players move their characters — represented by 32mm scale plastic miniatures — across the region, visiting Strongholds, exploring dungeons and meeting interesting characters as the story unfolds. But they are not the only ones there; roaming monsters appear, blocking roads and threatening the peace in Skyrim. Several game effects could lead to the fall of a Stronghold so players need to keep an eye on the state of unrest and the active dangers across the board.

Customizable Characters
There are no classes in Skyrim. Each character has a different starting innate ability and additional abilities that are unlocked as they learn specific skills, but that doesn’t mean that they are tied to a gameplay style. For example, even though Nords shine when they are developed with a focus on warrior skills and equipment, a player could decide to make their Nord a spellcaster, or a summoner, and still retrain midway through the game after finding an amazing sword they really want to use. Players can change their progression path mid-game, and enjoy many different play styles.

Upgradeable Equipment
There are plenty of equippable items: weapons, pieces of armor, trinkets, etc. Most of these items can be customized; by either Enchanting or Upgrading them in a Stronghold. When Upgrading or Enchanting an item, the player draws an Enchantment/Upgrade card, and slots it underneath the item, altering its properties. A piece of armor can be Upgraded so it becomes better against Heavy Attacks, for example, and it can also be Enchanted so it helps the character regenerate Stamina faster. When learning the Smithing and the Enchanting skills, the players get to draw more cards and choose between them, making the experience of customizing equipment richer and letting them focus on the playstyle they prefer. Furthermore, when playing in a group, one player can specialize their character in Enchanting or Smithing and upgrade all their allies' items by meeting in a Stronghold, adding another layer of cooperative gameplay.

Quests in Cards
The story in the game is told using Quest cards. Players draw Main Quests — those that push the narrative forward — and Personal Quests — side stories gained by exploring the vastness of the province of Skyrim. By completing or failing them, the story progresses. Many of these Quests give the players a choice at the end. This choice chains the Quest with a new one, creating a branching story that changes every time the game is played. Failing a quest doesn’t mean losing the game; instead, failure often becomes another way of choosing. The cards are organized in a way in which, if a card is removed as a result of Quest being failed or a game effect is triggered, the next card will take its place, dramatically changing the story.

Combat System
With an assortment of weapons, ranging from daggers to bows, players will be able to engage in combat with dangerous enemies, whether they be in a dungeon or part of a questline. Each weapon and spell will inform the player what attacks it can perform and how much Stamina or Magicka they’ll have to spend to use them. The player will roll the custom dice and attempt to overcome each weapon’s specific Skill Tests; hitting with heavier weapons is bound to be harder than hitting with lighter weapons. Combat is fast, exciting, and deadly, although strategy is a key factor to success. Some enemies, in fact, will employ unorthodox tactics, including the ability to heal themselves or wear nearly impenetrable armors.

Dungeon Crawling
Players can visit increasingly dangerous caves, mines, tombs, ruins, and Dwemer cities across Skyrim. Dungeons are built with cards each representing a major threat in that area of the dungeon. It might be a terrifying Draugr or a surprise trap that, if you’re lucky, one of the characters may be capable of disabling. As the characters level up, the lower-level adversaries are discarded, scaling the difficulty of the dungeons along with the player’s level. The more you visit a certain type of dungeon, the more likely you will see its more fearsome denizens, albeit with better rewards!

Cooperative
The whole game is fully cooperative. Players are encouraged to discuss their strategies and to collaborate to advance in their own storylines. Each player will be following their own storyline, joining together at the end of each chapter, when their plots are woven together into an epic finale for the whole party.
There are some situations where characters, even if they have the same overall goal, find themselves on opposite sides of a struggle, and may interfere with each other as they progress. This gives an interesting layer of light competitive gameplay, whilst still keeping the cooperative nature of the game in the forefront.
Expansions
The Dawnguard expansion will add a third campaign with three additional chapters to play through, new characters, dungeon adversaries, treasures, events, and more. One of our expansions will make the Ghosts of the Blades haunt you throughout Skyrim during the first Campaign of the game and another threatens devastation to Skyrim in the form of a great dragon! There is much more to be revealed through the Gamefound campaign. The team has planned for a massive upgrade kit converting all the wandering monsters over to 32mm scale plastic miniatures which are all compatible in scale with the miniatures game The Elder Scrolls Call to Arms. More information will be revealed in the run-up to the launch of the board game

All in all, the Elder Scrolls Skyrim Adventure Game will offer players dozens and dozens of hours of adventure exploring the game world. Expansions will ensure there’s even more Skyrim to be had.

This would be the third pledge I have sold and the others worked out fine. I change my mind a lot...

boardgame.name: Three Temples for the Ancient Ones: The Decrepit Ziggurat
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Three temples for the Ancient Ones is a three part campaign for OSR and fantasy games in general, in which players are guided to three different locations in search for ancient and forgotten tools.

The second of the three temples is the Decrepit Ziggurat, a dungeon located in ancient Mesopotamia, near Assyria. A huge complex of puzzles built as a safe place for the last of the tribes, followers of the Ancient race. In this adventure booklet you will find:

Puzzles
New enemies
New magic Items
An ancient god

boardgame.name: Donald Duck in Disneyland
boardgame.description:
Game for up to 6 players.
Each player chooses a Disney character, rolls the die and moves in the direction of the yellow arrow. If the arrow has a number, look in the rules to see what the player must do.

Artwork theme: Disney's Peter Pan movie

First one that reaches Cinderella's castle, wins.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Peter Pan

boardgame.name: Three Temples for the Ancient Ones: Lore Booklet
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Three temples for the Ancient Ones is a three part campaign for OSR and fantasy games in general, in which players are guided to three different locations in search for ancient and forgotten tools.

The Lore Booklet sets the background for the adventures, explaining how things connect to each other and giving a brief explanation about the reasons why players would engage on the search for the three temples.

boardgame.name: Herbarium Sanctum
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Throughout the ancient lands lies the ancient knowledge learned from the trees, flowers, grass and lands, a knowledge only known by the ones who have lived in here aeons agos, the ones who had a deep connection to nature, and who were able to talk to every single natural element present in those lands.

After the first and second conquest, with the arrival of the ones who wore steel and leather, the ancient tribes were decimated, and only a few of them survived, scattered through those lands. And it was thanks to Harol Nabuco that this ancient knowledge did not die. Harol and his scholar friend Kanindé Peregrino traveled all over the realm looking for these ancient people, learning a lot with them, and cataloging everything they had to teach. The parcial result of these trips are all in this document.

In the Herbarium Sanctum you will find 10 different herbs that can be found in your campaign scenario, how to use them, the cost of each and the weird effects they cause to the ones who use them.

boardgame.name: The Jester
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

For those willing to play your favorite OSR game with a chaotic individual, the jester is here!

In this pamphlet you will find 4 different progression charts for Jesters: Old School Essentials, Caves & Hexes, Dungeon Crawl Classics, and Lamentations of the Flame Princess.

You will also find a D66 table with the chaotic actions, the big thing behind the jester class! It is a table full of chaotic elements inspired by the most classic cartoons from the previous century.

boardgame.name: The Bakeneko
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new character class for your OSR games inspired by a Yokai from the japanese culture. Some kind of mystic thief with cat-like traits!

In this pamphlet you will find 3 different progression tables for Bakenekos:

Old School Essentials and Caves & Hexes

Dungeon Crawl Classics

Lamentations of the Flame Princess

You will also find rules related to the Bakeneko's mystic masks and their unique skills.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: The Üniførm
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Granted only to dishonourable types filtered through a precise recruitment funnel. When worn, the Üniførm allows the wearer to find shortcuts and tunnels in unexpected places.

boardgame.name: The Quick Family Generator
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Often your players will end up in a rut regarding their family and their looks. You might even have an issue where you keep generating the same family over and over with a fresh coat of paint.

The Quick Family Generator is intended to help get out of that creative rut by utilizing playing cards. These will determine not only whom your character looks like more, but your parents as well. The optional cards will help show are the size of the family to give you the most diverse family in mere minutes!

boardgame.name: Incredible Inns
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Incredible Inns is a collection of five fantastical Inns, designed for use in any campaign setting. Each Inn includes descriptions of the Owners, Staff, Patrons, some highlights and specials from the Menu and more! Every Inn also has its own Main Quest and Mini Quests, so your players will always have something to do any time they step foot in these brand new Inns!

boardgame.name: Quick Mage's Guild Generator
boardgame.description:
From the description:

You have your players heading into town, looking for a specific NPC. However, you don't have the guild they belong to, nor do you have the time to create a massive roster of information to add refreshing realism.

With three cards, you can get a structure set in place and use whatever means to fill out the key players in your new guild. All you need is a deck of cards and a way to take notes!

boardgame.name: Lost in the Caligo Fields
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The blacksmith’s son has wandered into the vast and unforgiving frozen wilderness. Can the party rescue him and uncover the darker mysteries at play in the Caligo Fields?

Lost in the Caligo Fields is a search-and-rescue hexcrawl optimized for a 4th level party for Fifth Edition. Built from the ground up to utilize Hexplorer Map tiles, this adventure features a system for navigating and exploring the treacherous and mist-filled arctic terrain. The Stonelakes – a nomadic tribe of Buranar – have halted traveling to their winter hunting grounds until Erilik, the smith’s son, returns. Presumed kidnapped by the brutish Moss Giants, the party must survive raiders, giants, the elements – and worse – if they are to save young Erilik. Featuring art from Pawel Parol, Shane Collins, Dean Spencer, Eric Pommer, Rick Hershey, and Bob Greyvenstein.

24 Page 5e Adventure for a 4th level party
2 Detailed NPCs with artwork and VTT Tokens
7 Battlemaps, each with 3 variations (grid, no grid, labeled)
A Navigational and Hexcrawl System designed from the ground up to use Hexplorer Map Tiles to maximum effect
Dozens of Progressive Discovery Tables and Random Encounter Tables
New Playable Race – the nomadic Buranar who are descended from frost giants
One new Monster – the druidic Moss Giants
New Items and Equipment including the Bearded Axe
Loaded with full-color artwork
12 Hexplorer Map Tiles to create a regional area for hex-crawl campaigns
Plug-and-play design to make dropping the adventure into your campaign as easy as possible with minimal prep

boardgame.name: Quick Priest's Guild Generator
boardgame.description:
From the description:

You have your players heading into town, looking for a specific NPC. However, you don't have the guild they belong to, nor do you have the time to create a massive roster of information to add refreshing realism.

With three cards, you can get a structure set in place and use whatever means to fill out the key players in your new guild. All you need is a deck of cards and a way to take notes!

boardgame.name: Quick Fighter's Guild Generator
boardgame.description:
From the description:

You have your players heading into town, looking for a specific NPC. However, you don't have the guild they belong to, nor do you have the time to create a massive roster of information to add refreshing realism.

With three cards, you can get a structure set in place and use whatever means to fill out the key players in your new guild. All you need is a deck of cards and a way to take notes!

boardgame.name: Inferno TCG
boardgame.description:
Inferno is a trading card game, where every player is a powerful demon that lives in the Inferno (a corrupted and distorted dimension). They battle other demons for the supremacy of the Earth.

Players build a deck of 50 cards and 1 demon card (avatar) and duel against an opponent's deck. Each deck has a combination of Allies, Objects, Weapons, Scenarios, Ritual and Resources; from the demon's path or neutral cards.

There are 4 path you can choose from: Chaos, Madness, Death and Power. Each path has it's own play style and abilities.

A match of the game ends when a Demon has no more cards in its deck. Every time a player get damaged, discard cards from his deck go to the discard pile (named Inferno).

boardgame.name: Chat Pardeurs: Meow York Mayhem
boardgame.description:
Chat pardeurs: Meow York Mayhem is an expansion for Chat pardeurs.

After the arrest of the kitthieves in San Franciscat, Supercat decides to follow the lead of the criminal organization that he thought was ruled by Al Chapone. His investigation leads him to Meow York, and with the help of Feline Girl, he discovers that there are also many dangers on the East Coast.

Chat pardeurs: Meow York Mayhem Expansion adds new gameplay.

4 players: superheroes can team up and face 2 kitthieves (2 vs 2).
A bunch of new kitthieves with new abilities.
New game mode using locations.

boardgame.name: Bonanza
boardgame.description:
In Bonanza, players draft cards from a common pool to create the strongest poker hand.

One card is dealt to each player. Five cards are placed face-up to the table. In playing order, each player takes a face-up card from the displayed selection, then replaces the drawn card with a new card from the deck. This is done in turn order until each player has 7 cards in their hand. They then reveal their hands. The best 5 card poker hand wins. The game can be played in multiple rounds for score. With 1 to 4 players, it is recommended to play with a short 32 card deck (7 through Ace) instead of the standard 52 card deck.

Bonanza is in the same family as Sacramento and Nugget.

Played with a standard deck of cards, published in Reiner Knizia's book Blazing Aces!: A Fistful of Family Card Games.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Blazing Aces!: A Fistful of Family Card Games

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Alley Cat
boardgame.description:
Alley Cat is a 2 player trick-taking game played with a modified traditional deck. There is no trump suit and suits do not matter.

At the beginning of the game, six cards are dealt to each player. On their turn, players play a single card to the table from their hand. After both players have played their single card, the "trick" is resolved. The highest card always takes the trick. The loser of the trick draws a card from the deck and adds it to their hand.

Tricks score points equal to the difference between values of the two cards in the trick. The alley cat (5 of diamonds) is a special card that causes negative points to a player's overall score for a round.

The game is over when one player reaches 44 or more points, thus winning the game.

boardgame.name: Toxic Potato
boardgame.description:
You will have to keep your eyes peeled so you know where the Toxic Potatoes are and how to keep them out of your hand.

Using a variety of special spuds at your disposal, you’ll pass, peel, steal, buy, and fry your way to survival. The last yam standing owns bragging rights, at least until the next game.

Toxic Potato is simple enough for younger kids to pick up, and strategic enough for adults to have a blast playing together. Easy to learn and quick to play, this is the game you will reach for again and again… Yes, just like that bag of potato chips on game night…

The rundown:

Everyone except one player is dealt a Toxic Potato.
Use your action cards—and a bit of luck—to pass Toxic Potatoes to others.
When a Radioactive or Hazmat card is played, anyone holding a Toxic Potato gets mashed!
But hold on, you've got a Detox or No Way card to save your Buttato!
Last spud standing is the Championchip… at least until the next round.


—description from the designer

listing.notes: KS edition, not even opened copy :) Enjoy!

boardgame.name: Battlegroup: Stalingrad
boardgame.description:
After Operation Barbarossa failed to defeat the Soviet Union in 1941, the war on the Eastern Front must continue. This time, the Germans prioritised their efforts in the south, towards the oil fields of the Caucasus region in Fall Blau (Case Blue). German and Axis armies will advance east, into the Caucusus’, along the Don river and across it to the Volga. Their sweeping summer advances will bring them to the city of Stalingrad. The infamous Battle of Stalingrad will become a turning point in WWII, a savage house-to-house battle through the ruins of the city to halt the Germans and draw-in ever more forces, until a Russian counter-offensive can be launched to encircle the entire German 6th Army.


HISTORICAL BACKGROUND


A complete overview of war in southern Russia in 1942, starting with preliminary operations in the spring, the the start of Fall Blau, the Battle of Voronezh, Operations on the Don, Operation Edelweiss’ drive into the Caucasus region, the Battle of the Don Bend and the panzers’ drive to the Volga and Stalingrad. Inside Stalingrad, the ‘Death on Volga’ section deals specifically with the weeks of brutal close-quarters fighting through the city’s streets and its three factory complexes.

ARMY LISTS:


Nine army lists are included for the Germans, their Axis allies and the Red Army. These are: German Panzer and Infantry Division battlegroups, Italian and Rumanian battlegroups and the Hungarian 1st Armoured Division battlegroup. For the Russians, army lists for Rifle Divisions and battlegroups created from their new Tank Corps. ‘Death on Volga’ pits specially equipped German assault Stossgruppe infantry battlegroups against the ragged but dug-in and determined ‘Defenders of Stalingrad’.

SPECIAL RULES:


New rules to adapt the core Battlegroup game to the battlefields of the Eastern Front in 1942,

including the Battle of Stalingrad. Recreating the character of the war from the rolling steppes of southern Russian to the twisted wreckage of Stalingrad’s factories. The book includes new additional detailed rules for street-fighting, a new urban combat scenario Stadtkampf and a mini-campaign system for the ferocious fighting for the Barrikady gun factory.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Baron's Gambit
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Recruited by the Baron of Cat’s Cradle, the characters are tasked with investigating the deaths of some guardsmen in a small hamlet known as Baron’s Gambit. They will end up exploring the ruins of an abandoned temple in search of a strange foe, and uncovering a secret that could make them quite rich ... provided they survive. Baron’s Gambit is an introductory adventure for first level characters.

boardgame.name: MOAR Monsters
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

MOAR monsters contains a deadly and devious offering of monsters to supplement the ones in the Swords & Wizardry Monster Book. Many of these have previously been published, but there are some that have never before been seen, such as the moon-dwelling lunormians and the deceptive exclosures. Every Referee always needs more monsters, and here they are ... MOAR Monsters!

boardgame.name: Meiun: The Year of Destiny
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The land of Nendo is locked in a terrible prophetic dream. This prophecy, the words spoken by the prophets of the Mountain, has thrown its shadow across the people for ages. Now in the year of destiny, it finally has met a challenger. You see, the Mountain isn't the only force of Nendo. Drawing its strength from the unknown over the centuries, growing more and more powerful in darkness, the River now has enough might to step from the shadow of the Mountain's prophecy. Take on the role of an eternal goddess, a Rose Maiden, whose only purpose is to break prophecy and usher in a new era of wonder to a land that is dying of stagnation. Acting through her dream, a human woman in the land of Nendo, can you free everyone from blissful stagnation of prophecy?

boardgame.name: Absolute Destiny Apocalypse
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Not so long ago, or maybe in the not so far future,
not so far away, or maybe not in this world at all...
A boarding school known solely as the Academy.
Nine students facing their fears, hopes and destinies,
involved in a series of secret duels.
Machiavellian agents of a sacred order.
A shadow cast by a decadent sect.
An enigma of love and hate unfolds.
A promise of the Revolution.

boardgame.name: ACTS: The Greatest Entertainment in the World
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You had a life, you're sure of it. Back in that grey haze before the palace, before you met the Prince. It doesn't make logical sense that anything would have happened before that… but something just doesn't feel right. If there were no pre-life, why do you hate the cook so much? What's that bizarre memory you have, disjointed in time, of a big dog running through fields of grass? And when did you learn to do math so well? There is absolutely no reason a court poet should understand logarithms.
boardgame.rpg: ACTS: The Greatest Entertainment in the World

boardgame.name: Dark Messiah: The Threads of the Sacred Rose
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Paranormal Investigations Incorporated. Our mission is to identify, record and resolve as many paranormal occurrences as we can. Beware however, this job is not without potential danger, the secrets you may uncover may just shatter your world.
boardgame.rpg: Dark Messiah: The Threads of the Sacred Rose

boardgame.name: Holy Mountain Shaker
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

Holy Mountain Shaker

Thunder and quake have come to the old town. Towers crumble, homes tumble, the quick become the dead. What omen could be more obvious? The Pharaoh Fish under the mountain is displeased. This God must be propitiated. Brave heroes must venture to buy the city’s salvation. At the very least, the Town Council needs to appear in control and send some ‘expert adventurers’ into the depths.

A fantasy pointcrawl adventure for characters of 5th to 6th level.

Requires Old-School Essentials Classic Fantasy or Advanced Fantasy.
